review_description: My experience is great, yes, but Badoo needs you to be able to copy everything that is information, questions to chat and not have a limit, to be able to copy whatever you want from the information, for example, if it is a language that you do not know or do not understand, to be able to copy it and be able to talk to whoever you want quickly and that each Badoo user has to verify their account such as photo, phone number, social networks and thus have more confidence in talking to people and

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: It has gotten better, at first the meetings were pixelated and I could really see but after sending feedback they seem to have corrected the issue, but still sometimes the camera goes into a sort of slow motion. It happens every so often but is way better than before, and nice little apps that you can play with while meeting/talking, that changes the background scenery and adds costumes, that's pretty neat, also your able to easily take a picture of you and the other person, very nice.
developer_response: Hi, Will. Please check your cellular or Wi-Fi connection. The Wi-Fi or mobile data icon should have at least 1 bar. If you experience bad connectivity, please move to a location with better connection. If you still have issues, submit feedback by tapping the three dot menu in the top right corner - Help & Feedback - Send Feedback. Thanks!

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Works great for what it's needed for. However, not all devices have the same features, my phone has the filters while my daughters (different brand) does not. Also, would have given 5‚≠ê if conference calling was a feature, allowing more than 2 calls at a time, 3 or more connected together. Neither of our devices allow this feature.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: It's borderline unbelievable that this doesn't have the ability to change the audio source. I can't switch from Bluetooth to speaker phone in the app. If I'm listening to music on my speaker, I have to physically go in and turn off Bluetooth to take the video call or the whole neighborhood has to listen to my call. A simple toggle would fix this. What a massive miss by the dev.
developer_response: Hi, Brian. Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback. We're sorry to hear that. We'll pass this along to the team so they can continue iterating on your feedback to make Duo even better. We ask that you submit feedback within the Duo app by clicking the Menu button then the 'Help and Feedback' tab and tap 'Send Feedback'. Thank you.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Well trying to figure out why it's a default as well it just needs to be what it is all the other works can be done on chrome screen lacking. just don't use buffer system with pixel screen or moving motion picture. reduce sound source and it will take care of the interference and instagoo can provide in background details from the I phone's and desk tops

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: The quality of the video call is actually, better than I thought it would be. It had a clear picture, it didn't lag a bit though. If you use a background image, that will also make the lag worse and it slightly messes up the quality of the picture. I enjoy being able to turn on a background (so people don't necessarily know where I am though) for privacy reasons. So, I would take the little bit of lag for the privacy.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: When it was duo it was fine, but it switched over to Google Meet and since then it's been weird. It'll be fine for a while with all the buttons to mute/turn off camera, hang up, switch camera and the additional buttons, like drawing and screen share, but then sometimes they just disappear which sucks. Also the call quality has gone downhill, it's always laggy and doesn't work the best and it's just overall become an unreliable thing where you never know what you're about to get.
developer_response: Hi, Lillian. Please check your cellular or Wi-Fi connection. The Wi-Fi or mobile data icon should have at least 1 bar. If you experience bad connectivity, please move to a location with better connection. If you still have issues, submit feedback by tapping the three dot menu in the top right corner - Help & Feedback - Send Feedback. Thanks!

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: It takes too long to connect. Once you connect it takes 30 seconds to get audio and video. Unlike Apple and FaceTime once you connect you can instantly talk... Please fix this so it's usable on various networks. It also takes a while to switch over from Wi-Fi to cellular and back and forth. Fix the algorithm and the Kodak so that is seamless.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Excellent quality video, with crisp and clear microphone quality. There are also some additional features such as background adjustment and funny filters, but overall, it's just a well made product. I wish it were more integrated into the existing system of texting/calling, but maybe in the future.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: It's hell to type a text and send it. Very simple thing is hard. Thanks for the response to my comment above. To elaborate, when I am typing and I make a mistake. If I want to put the flashing bar at the word I made a mistake, it is impossible. So I have to type my message again from the begining. Plus, There is not way to see the history of messages in one screen. I have to go back to another screen and tap on each message to see the text before. It'e hard to send and to read messages.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: The more I use this app the more I like it and find things that I like about it. The call quality as well as picture is near perfect. It's an easy way to communicate with friends, family or business associates in a simple, fun yet professional and well put together presentation. A lot of video conferencing apps are very cheesy or have a gimmick to them and this is just straightforward with a few fun extras but the essentials you need and executed with the quality you would expect from Google.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Used to be nice but there is this awful filter over my face that always makes me look bad. I can't get rid of it unless I adjust the angle and lighting of my room to replicate perfect conditions. With just the slightest of change it gives me the silly filter again that is completely unnecessary and makes things darker than it should be. There is no setting to change this either it is just there by default.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: The picture is clear most of the time except when the wifi you're using doesn't have a strong signal. appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: It worked before it became "Meet". I see a review from someone in early December with the same issue and same model phone; s10. I can't call at least one specific person. appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Was able to have a conversation and the connection was good. No glitches and I live in a rural area. I enjoyed being able to look through other areas in my phone and still have video working. I was able to search through Google and not lose the call or video while doing this. Duo always closed the video if you left the app during the call. Much better experience with a video call than I've previously had.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Very useful when you travel a lot and have to speak to your spouse from a variety of hotel rooms. It would be nicer if when the signal quality degrades, it would simply freeze the image, rather than deteriorate and pixelate. And go in and out a bit more smoothly. (Perhaps that's impossible because you would have to introduce a lag into the call). But it's a very very useful tool and I am quite satisfied with it.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Haven't liked the upgrade to meet. The old Duo app was easier and was more stable. Missing most basic functions that you would expect in a messaging or meet application. Would really like to be able to be able to view pictures or files when using the voice. Currently you have to end the call to send or receive, notes, pictures or anything else. Lastly a dark mode would be good.

review_description: It works great at times, the quality of the video calls are far better than most other social media platforms. Audio needs improvement. appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls

review_description: Can not figure out how to change the name of the meeting. It shows up as a bunch random letters that looks like code. I just want it to say my name. There's no way to change it. Also all of my contacts are synced up to my minor sons google account. I can't figure out how to un sync the contacts. appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Whenever I try to make a video call, the other party never hears it's ringing. Turns out the ringtone for Google meet is barely audible, and wasn't immediately able to figure out how to change the ringtone to something louder, very user unfriendly settings, even upon looking up how to do it on Google, the directions were very sketchy at best. I can only use Google meet if I place a regular call with my phone and give them a heads up that I'm going to call them on Meet. Very unpractical!

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: When I first hit video button it was slow and my picture flashed like a strobe light. Sometimes I get random calls from ppl I have not seen in a long time. This is the only way they knew how to connect with me. GOOD THING!!! Robot sounds mostly. I try to move around so that I have clear pictures and sound. Doesn't always work. I'm sure best internet would not solve problem exspecially 3 or 4 time zones away

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Don't like the new update and how the video messages expire after 24 hours and are now only 30 seconds instead of 1 minute- See no point in changing it. Should make it optional for them to expire and should make the videos be longer/your choice as of how long they are. Other than that, video call quality is good and the other features such as the drawing are nice, but the update is extremely frustrating.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: I use it nightly to video chat with my parents, and getting a connection established is such a pain. I try calling them and they try calling me, but it takes several attempts before one of our calls rings on the other's device. I don't understand why it has such a difficult time when both parties have strong wifi signals. Very very frustrating, I wish there was a better, free alternative that works cross-platform like this does.

review_description: Duo was a good option for video chats between my android and people with iOS. But since Meet, the app has been crashing when trying to place a call; coming up with "unexpected error". Incoming calls have started to not show too, but my Fitbit rings. I've tried reinstalling the app and no change. Any advice on a fix would be helpful. appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Call quality is great, and the fact that It's cross-platform makes it even better because you don't have to worry about which device your friends have. The only issue I have with it right now is that the call ringtone is a text sound like I'm getting spammed with text messages whenever I get a 1:1 call and there is no way to change it to an actual ringtone, I remember when this app was called Duo it had a really nice ringtone for incoming calls. I'll edit my rating once this is fixed.
developer_response: Hi, Arian. You can change the custom ringtone on Google Duo by tapping on the 3 dots > Settings > Notifications > Receive 1:1 Calls > Advance > Sound. Hope this helps!

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Solid quality of calls overall, I had almost no issues with connecting, sound and video. Now I'm using a tablet, and there is no way to share audio from your device unfortunately, which would be a very useful feature. And sharing a window/Google chrome tab, not the whole screen is extremely handy too. These work well on a desktop when using chrome, but not on a tablet app. I hope engineers can add these functions in the nearest future.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Been using for ages and was fine until a week ago. Now audio calls have literally no audio at all. Video calls audio is fine but I only use this app for audio and now neither of us can hear eachother. Tried uninstalling, clearing cache, trying on a different device etc. But no audio for audio calls at all. Please help fix this Edit... to your response, I've already done all of those things lol. So what do you suggest after I've already tried the options you give me, which obviously do not work??
developer_response: Hi, Stephanie. If you're on a call and you experience audio issues, you may refer to this link: https://goo.gle/31sYHAh under "Fix video or sound issues on a call" section. Also, you can ask a question in our Duo Community Forum: https://goo.gle/2nWc7E6. Hope this helps.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Excellent app for easily connecting with your family and friends all over the world with a simple procedure as calling over the phone. No ads, no pop-ups, no short-term limits, no call disconnection, no interruption. I recommended this to all my contacts, and we all are closely related now. Thanks, Meet. Keep connecting!

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: While I agree with others that it's more fiddly than previously as Duo, my family and I have had no problems with it since set-up and have had some great calls with good quality. Obviously it was easier just to click the camera icon previously, next to the Contact name, and I don't know why Google changed that but it does what it's meant to and that's all I want. Don't know if we are just lucky but it's (so far anyway) a 10/10 for us üòÄ.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: -edit- I can not configure any of the options you just mentioned. I have resorted to sharing pictures of text made in a separate application since it's broken. sucks now. All my history is deleted, can only send voice and video messages - not pictures or texts, and all messages expire after 24 hours. None of this is configurable. Which means all unsaved old messages are gone.
developer_response: Hi, Christopher. After you play a message, you can revisit it at any time unless you changed your Duo settings to delete messages 24 hours after they play. If you don't want your messages to be deleted automatically, open the Duo app, click the three dots at the top right corner, go to Settings, tap Message Settings and turn on Save Messages.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Duo worked. This doesn't. Every time i call home devices, it shows I'm video calling, but wifey says its ringing on living room speaker, and she can't answer it. I've set the settings to kitchen display only. Now it drops my call without even ringing. Never had this problem when it was Duo. Added... I'll raise you 2 stars for such a quick response to my issue. Thank you.

Please continue to help improve Duo by sending feedback within the Duo app through clicking the Menu button then the 'Support' tab and tapping on 'Send Feedback'. Thank you for letting us know.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: I wish I could give you zero stars. Duo was a great app that worked seamlessly and just like everything else that isn't broken but gets "fixed," it was completely ruined with this counter intuitive piece of garbage that makes everything more involved than it has to be. Some people don't have time to answer a bunch of irrelevant questions and then learn how to use the app through trial and error. Thank you for adding to my frustration today.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: Google meet blows Google Duo out of the water. Crystal clear images and the ability to take photos and share them with the group is a bonus. It's also great that you can include closed caption and have transcripts saved of your meeting agenda and discussion. Ability to have a discussion with up to 100 people. It is totally free and unlike Zoom there's no time limit. Easy to send invitations to prospective attendees. Overall a very easy-to-use app.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: The best when it comes to video and audio calls by quality. Chatting experience isn't good at all. Better stick to calls only. The March 16 2023 update has broken the app from accessing the camera. Video calls can't work. The app can't establish connection to the camera. But I guess the issue get fixed soon. The camera is working pretty well with other applications except for this app alone. And this has happened after updating to the latest version.
developer_response: Hi, Kyambadde. Kindly check if the Google Duo app has permission to access your camera. Also, please make sure your camera is functioning in other applications.

appName: Google Duo - High Quality Video Calls
review_description: I really like this app, but it is EXTREMELY unreliable. It does not matter where I am or where the other person is. Most times, it will not work that day. It would ring not even once and immediately say they didn't answer. Other times, I would answer the call, and it would make a difference ring sound and disconnect me. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS APP!
