Noooo! You can't remove SMS support! The thing that makes this app great is the seamless integration with normal messaging. When I convince friends to join Signal it's seamless! About 70% of my messages are encrypted, in part because it's so easy to bring people over! If you take away the SMS then the quiet integration of encryption is lost. That's a big loss! Signal doesn't need "stories" or other social media features, but it does need SMS! Now that it's gone messaging is annoying.

I love how easy the app is and it allows for individual chat customization. The security and privacy is nice. One improvement I would love to see is in group chats for it to show a little thumbnail of who has read the post instead of just the checkmark. I know you can hold down on a message and look at info to see who has read it but that's not as convenient.

I really appreciate the privacy, features, open source, security, scheduling of this app! So much so that it's the only free app that I've ever paid for. Also, I invite everyone that has texted me to use signal and feel exposed when I have to go back to SMS or Telegram. I refuse to use FB or Whatsapp or Instagram. Just started using desktop sync with mobile. Would be nice to transfer call from mobile to desktop.

Signal has been an excellent tool until recently, and I've been able to get several others to use it. However, their announcement that they are dropping SMS support is a deal breaker. I can't flip between multiple apps for messaging. Once the change has been made, I'll have to uninstall it. Most of the folks I know who use it plan to do the same. It's cross-platform functionality is what has made it such a versatile and functional app, and an "easy sell" to other potental users.

Much better than all the other messengers. A lot more secure and really appreciate it allowing to download stickers. One major problem is sometimes, after I sent a message, it takes a while before it's sent. Weirdly enough, I could close the app and open it back up and then it would be sent. If I don't, it takes a lot longer. Sometimes something I sent takes 10 minutes ish to even be sent out. Not my wifi problem just to clarify.

I liked this app until the news that they are dropping SMS. Will never be able to entice anyone to switch to it now for all the reasons others have said. My other gripe is that I have only been able to attach one picture per message, requiring multiple texts to send two or three pictures. Guess that doesn't matter any more. I'll hold onto it for a while in case the people at Signal sober up and restore SMS functionality but until they do it is basically worthless.

UPDATED 2/19/23: Since users are no longer able to send or receive SMS text messages through thus app, there is no longer a need to keep it. What was once a fantastic app has now turned into a waste of space. Nice job! 2021 review: Great app! Able to send documents as well as the usual MMS/SMS messages. You're also able to CALL through the app as well. I like the end to end encryption as well.

Great app! I used it for years. The discontinuation of SMS support is a move I understand, but it does mean I will have to change to a new default messenger app. Great if you have enough people in your life who use signal! Edit : dropped d a star because the exporting of messages doesn't seem to have worked. That's not great. Sucks to have to many conversations and information lost in the shuffle

Love the app and I have been using it whenever possible! However, there are a few things that should be changed: 1) the possibility to schedule backups. Whenever my phone is performing a signal backup it becomes useless for over 10 minutes and this mostly happens at inopportune times, very annoying. 2) It should be possible to reply/react to individual pictures when these are sent in bulk. So far one can only react to the entire message but not individual photos in the message

Like many other users reviewing here, I am deeply disappointed that Signal is removing SMS functionality and will be uninstalling as soon as that goes live. There is literally no point to using a messaging app that forces you to use multiple apps for different types of messages. I have overall been very pleased with Signal (apart from not being able to send videos in the app and the phone call quality, which is usually glitchy), so I'm sad that I won't be able to use the app soon.

The Signal Protocol is world-class. Its implementation in the Signal app is best-in-class. It's well designed, robust, stable, secure and [was] compatible with non-secure services. All Signal software is free, ad-free and open-source. What's not to like? 2/2023 - Lack of universality is a deal-breaker. Too bad Signal narrowed their app's usefulness by dropping SMS support. That forced me to switch to Google as my default messenger.

This app is great for having private, end-to-end encryptesmd conversations with people who also have signal. It's easy as hell to set up for the first time, and I love how everything about it is privacy focused, from the messages and calls to the disappearing messages feature you can set, so that after a message has been read by the recipient, it will delete itself after a specified time. That's pretty dope. I love signal. And it's onboarding process is simple as can be. It should be used more

My go-to text app for years, highly recommended... Or it was. After removing of unsecure sms I'll have to find something else. I've used the app going on 10 years now and have convinced about 10 people to switch, a couple of which have switched back. It'll no longer be worth using it for only the few who still do. What made signal great was that you could use it for everyone and it would use encryption for those that also had it automatically. I wish I could keep using it as I have for so long

Pretty good all around but the removal of sms is a great leap backwards. Having signal as the main sms option was why I have it in the first place. The extra security is great and many of my friends made the switch to it, but it is already unreliable for getting messages on time and notified. I will not be exacerbating the issue by splitting my messages between two or more apps

Signal was a great app. I have used for several years and part of that greatness was its integration with SMS. Because of that integration I was able to get a few friends to use it too. Because of signals terrible choice to remove sms support, I will be less likely to use and recommend this app. They have time to put Instagram like stories, but not keep a key functionality of this messaging app included.

Best messaging service ever invented! I use this messaging service exclusively with all of my clients. I use it with my family members. I use it with my employees. It is super easy to create groups, it is easy to unsend or delete messages if you need to. You can do screen shares, video calls, everything. I wish every messaging app worked like this.

Used to be a great app, but it has been taking near about 16+ hours for messages to be delivered and/or received. Before that became an issue, notifications wouldn't appear unless loading up the app. Something has gone wrong relatively recently, and nothing on my end has changed. Edit: Bumped to 3 stars from 2. Delays are less rare, notifications still an issue Edit 2 (3/9/23): Dropped to 2 starts again, don't receive notifications for exactly 7 minutes.

I've been using Signal for years, and it's been mostly terrific. But the fact they're dropping sms support means to keep it, I'd have to use two different messaging apps, and that's just not gonna happen. So sadly I'll be getting rid of it soon. I'd recommend to people in the same boat, that if you want to send secure texts, just use a burner you paid cash for, and one that you can put money on with cash.

Works great. It's good to have messages & calls that are really private, especially now. Update: They are ending SMS support soon, this will no longer be as useful as before. Many will leave Signal, as most conversations don't really need it, and it's a hassle to have multiple messaging apps. I know purists will disagree, but they'll be preaching to shrinking choir.

This app was perfect for me and many other users until Signal decided to remove SMS support. This seems like a step backwards, even if the original goal of Signal was to provide an encrypted messaging service, Users like me have enjoyed the convenience of an all-in-one messaging app only to drop support for the main reason most people were using signal in the first place. Bad move, I hope this is corrected after Developers see a large decrease in users after the change is fully implemented.

I've used signal for a long time, and promoted it to many people, but with the announcement that SMS support is being dropped, I am now planning to drop it like a hot potato and move on. This is just not cool, and makes little sense whatsoever. Whitlw it has never been my favorite security solution, it was convenient being able to have moderate security AND standard SMS in a single app, but this change is just a deal-breaker and unacceptable for my and so many other's needs.

So far I love it. And I like the idea behind it. Performance is pretty good. Let's hope it stays the course. 2/22/23 Update. Disappointed in the direction of the company. Dropping sms, added stickers and stories, random delivery times, some 30mins some 30hrs... we just wanted a secure messaging app. I'm gonna uninstall it :(

Edit: I'm not getting notifications anymore. All of my settings are enabled so that's not the problem. I was very excited about this app because I was able to send videos via text. I have Verizon and trying to send a video through Messenger never works out, it's always blurry and pixelated. My videos send crystal clear to the recipient now. I also love the video chat feature. I have an Android so I don't have FaceTime. The app was amazing until I no longer get notifications :(

Worked excellently for video calls--at first. Now nobody can hear my audio in video calls, which is unacceptable. I can't find any settings to fix this, and closing and restarting the app doesn't work. If it still actually worked for calls, I'd give it 5 stars. But I can't, since audio doesn't work in calls anymore.

I have used Signal for multiple years, and am incredibly disappointed with the decision to remove SMS texting support. I am very happy with the app in its current state, but not being able to use it as my main messaging app is going to lead me to delete it. I enjoyed being able to back up messages and have a secured app to read my texts along with Signal messages. While I understand their reasoning, I hope the developers reconsider.

Signal is fantastic! It is a true feature-rich, privacy-focused replacement for group messaging across different platforms (Android, iOS, macOS, Windows, and Linux) that requires a valid phone number to set up, vastly decreasing the chance of receiving bot/spam texts (unlike other messenger services that allow anyone with an email address to sign up). Signal doesn't "phone home" or have access to your messages. My family and friends love Signal!

Amazing app, has allowed me to bring several friends that aren't as concerned with privacy into a secure environment. However with the recent decision to drop sms, most of those friends will certainly be dropping the app and I may as well. The usp of signal used to be a single messaging app where e2e encryption is avalible cross platform. The app serves little to no purpose if I only have 1 or 2 contacts on it as there are plenty of channels where this protected communication can happen. Sorry

Been using the app for awhile now. It has a bunch of issues when I first downloaded it, but most of those issues have been fixed which I'm thankful for. This app is amazing. It may not have all the snazzy customization options as messengee or what's app but thats not why I got it. I got it because I wanted privacy. This app is it. Highly recommend. Edit: taking two stars off because messages refuse to send. Me and my partner have been getting extremely frustrated.

I like Signal, but the news that they are dropping SMS is a deal breaker. Most people don't use it, and some people I know tried it and got turned off by its "feature" that alerts everyone in your contacts list that you have Signal. Some people don't WANT to be found. Anyway, when SMS support leaves, I'm going back to my native phone chat, although with regrets.

Was great, now less so. This used to be an exceptional app for messaging and phone calls. Some time last year, that changed. Now phone calls are almost pointless. The longer you salty on the call, the longer the lag in the spoken word and delivered works. We tend to give up when the lag is 10 seconds. As for messaging, it is still ok but suffers with certain phone permissions on off brand android so that it never alerts when there is a message until you open the app. Frustrating.

Update: It's still great for people who use signal, but it no longer supports sms. I hope this is temporary. Until then, I have to use different texting services. Original: Great app that protects your privacy! Messages come through faster than the standard texting on your phone! I love that I can use this as my my main texting, even with people who don't have this app.

This used to be a useful app. And I supported with $. It no longer integrates with SMS/MMS. My messages are now split between 2 apps. The export utility failed. Now my history is split between 2 apps. There have been significant delays in message delivery. Moxie Marlinspike had a good idea with TextSecure/RedPhone, which when commercialized met with #enshittification. The app continually presents a popup asking for $. There is no way to permanently dismiss the popup.

20230131 - I'll be deleting the app as soon as they stop supporting SMS. The whole point for me was that it is a single app that can send secure messages to those who use signal and SMS to those who don't. Now they're putting up walls and removing great functionality. There are plenty of apps that allow you to securely send messages over the internet. The benefit of Signal WAS that it was an all-in-one with SMS.

Worked great, & did everything I could have hoped for regarding security & being a one stop shop for sms+messaging. However, with them dropping sms support I no longer care to use it. I don't need just a messaging app. If I did, I'd have downloaded one of the more popular messaging apps and called it a day. For the time I used it I can't think of one complaint, aside from the dropped sms support.

It was great while it lasted. I used signal so I could have my secure contacts and my insecure contacts in the same place. Now that signal is dropping sms support I'll have to find a new service to replace signal entirely. Haven't started looking because signal was so good I never had to even think about another service for anything. As soon as I can find a service that offers both secure and insecure messages in the same place I'll be moving everything over from signal and it's useless.

App will delete everything if you reinstall! I have used this app for years. I had to uninstall and reinstall after this last forced update wouldn't work. It kept telling me the update wouldn't install. After I reinstalled I lost EVERYTHING. years of chats, all my contacts, it basically acts like it has never seen me before. I have unistalled and reinstalled messaging apps before and that has never happened. I'm pretty upset.

Until censorship takes place this app has proven its good to use. Easy no bs. It remains one of the all-time best messaging apps I've ever used. Notifications are iffy when the updates for the phone are installed. Some don't work for a week and some actually change the alert sound in spite of my preferences . Great App Thanks and keep up the good work!

By removing support for SMS, I now have to split messaging apps between "people who care to use signal" and my "non technical" contacts. The result is falling back to using unencrypted chat for everything. I was able to onboard so many extra users in the past because the app supported both methods. RIP signal, you were the best. I've uninstalled you after a decade of use. I loathe the direction you've taken. An all or nothing security approach means I'm taking nothing.

After using this app for 5 years and convincing some others to switch, I'm moving away from it. Not enough people use it for it to be worthwhile, and the removal of SMS means it's losing its most valuable feature - seamless switching to secure messaging once someone else signs up. The devs wrongly calculated that people will switch in droves because of privacy. Most of the people I got to switch already left, and it's not worth keeping to have secure conversations with just a few people.

Great alternative to using Facebook messenger. Group chats are pleasant with this, you don't lose your place catching up to messages when you open links like fb. The audio message feature lets you adjust the speed to be fast or slow. I like that you can caption the photos sent at the same time. Only improvement would be if this app could function as a floating bubble like Facebook messenger, but everything else is executed so well that its a minor desire.

Was great. They're dropping SMS support, so I exported and went back to the built messenger program. They let me delete my SMS messages from Signal after the export, and the only things I had left were notifications about people now being on Signal and a single conversation with a friend's dad from 2 years ago. Uninstalling it because it is no longer useful. A shame.

Previously, Signal seized control of text messaging and phone calls and generally made a mess on my phone. I downloaded and installed the most recent version to communicate with someone who was in an area without text service. Signal no longer grabs control of calls and texts. So far it has worked great for all functions. Even making Video calls has worked well, though at lower video res than Meet. They really did a great rework of this app. Highly recommended now. Better than RCS apps.

I used to have an enthusiastic 5 stars, now you have removed the core functionality that made this app good. If I can't replace my default message app then this is just an add-on that I can not feasibly convince anyone to use. I got some of my friends to switch over to signal over the years but the main selling point was 'this isn't an extra communication app, it's pretty much a replacement for your normal messaging app with extra security for users on the platform.'

It seems as though what was trying to be forward-thinking in terms of communication is turning into it's own special secret social media. With the removal of SMS functionality, it makes the app less enticing for new users. This comes after making "stories" a thing; something that has NOTHING to do with the act of encrypted communication and all to do with the look-at-me mentality of social media. As if retention is a priority now. Especially a shame if you've donated. The app will be useless.

Would have been 4 stars before the dropping of sms mainly because I can't send video to non signal users. Every phone I have owned has made me choose a primary app to have my messages come in through. This change will force me back to a non secure choice and I'll be dropping the app because I am not going to change my settings every other time I need to send messages. I had very few issues up to this point but as others have said: If/when this goes live it's a deal breaker and I'm out.

I used to have an enthusiastic 5 stars, now you have removed the core functionality that made this app good. If I can't replace my default message app then this is just an add-on that I can not feasibly convince anyone to use. I got some of my friends to switch over to signal over the years but the main selling point was 'this isn't an extra communication app, it's pretty much a replacement for your normal messaging app with extra security for users on the platform.'

Goodbye Signal. I uninstalled because SMS support was dropped. I wanted to like and support this app. But beyond not supporting SMS anymore, it's lacking important basic features such as you can't attach video or files larger than a magabyte. Can't attach more than one image at a time. No ability to schedule messages. No spam filtering. I was rooting for you Signal! So long!

Removal of sms support is the wrong move! I absolutely love this app, I have used it for years. But the recent removal of sms integration has me looking for a different solution. IMHO there was no need to do so, the reason cited was "gui limitations" by keeping the support. I don't want to have to use multiple apps as not everyone I know is willing to switch to signal. This makes it frustrating to keep using signal. Sad part is, my review will have zero impact. Thanks for chasing me away signal!

Great program for security. I only use this for communication via text. I have not tried chat. This app works great under Nexus6. Verifying communication is great and very easy to update via the scan function. I have been using this now for a year and I have not had any major issues. Great app! Kinda upset SMS went away. Now I have to use another app and I'm not getting reponses back. I know SMS is not secure but some contacts I have refuse to install signal on their devices to communicate.

I never write reviews so that says something that I'm taking the time to write this one. Signal has been an outstanding ap with exception to not being able to send videos. But ending SMS support is where you've lost me. I enjoyed it while it lasted but I have too many people who don't use signal that will make it not worth it to keep the ap without the ability to interact with SMS users. I sincerely hope you change your mind.

Signal used to be great for privacy, but now that they are dropping SMS support it seems pointless if you don't have many other people in your contacts list currently using Signal. Signal as the default SMS app made sense, those that have it will get your messages via Signal, everyone else can message you by default. Now it's being segmented into two apps again, your default SMS app, and Signal separately. Guess which one will no longer be used...

My go to app. One thing stopping me from giving it 5 stars, I need to edit my texts after I send them. I make a lot of typos/forget words. Also, keyboards nowadays are very intrusive and correct things that shouldn't be corrected. It's so annoying. Please add the ability to edit text after it is sent.

I've used Signal for years, almost from the very beginning. Over all that time it's been the best app for secure communication between those that also us it, AND as my default SMS messaging app. But with the announcement that they're removing SMS functionality, this app fails. Only one other person I talk to uses Signsl now. So rather than have multiple messaging apps, I'm just deleting Signal.

SMS functionally going away. Why? This was meant to replace my main texting app. How am I ever going to get people to switch to signal if they have to get all their friends to switch to signal? It's extremely clear when messages are sent securely and when they aren't. You put a massive unlocked padlock on every SMS message that comes through. This is a death blow to Signal.

I never recurve notifications if someone texts calls come in just fine but, but I have to constantly open the app all day to see if someone has texted. Usually they have and it's really annoying to say "sorry I didn't see your message till now" because I'm not getting notified. P.S. ALL of my notification settings are on, for my phone as well a the app itself.

Loved the app but dropping integrated SMS support really leaves me with no use for it. If I want an app that ONLY offers encrypted messaging without SMS support there are better apps to use. The only thing Signal had going for it was the app serving as a bit of a one stop shop for all of my messaging needs. Yes, SMS is unsecure, but it's on the end user to be aware of these limitations. But hey, at least the dev team keeps rolling out superficial features that don't improve functionality.

it's nice that it works both with signal Communications that are encrypted SMS and MMS. Unfortunately with SMS or MMS messages it's not able to remove people from groups or some other things. I think that's just the nature of SMS and MMS messages. The other current disadvantage is that there aren't too many people who use signal yet. It is easy to transfer to a new phone.

Signal does not update on it's own. Have to manually open Play Store, search and update. . Signal will not send alerts when messages are received if your version is not the latest, even if the app is running (minimized). Wouldn't be a big problem except that there seems to be updates almost daily. This has led to many missed messages. . Overall, really like the app and the privacy it affords.

Frankly, what made Signal work for me was that the android app was (for me) essentially an all-in-one text messaging app. By removing SMS support, it loses what made it appealing to me: increased security with a number of my messages, but also convenient messaging. I'm not sure if I'll drop the app when SMS support ends, but it seems like the path of least resistance.

Don't install this app. The new owners of Signal have turned their backs on their users by removing SMS & MMS support. No one wants to juggle 2 different messaging apps, each with its own selection of contacts, group chats and capabilities. Delete Signal and just use something that works for EVERY CONTACT you have. Signal no longer does that, which explains why its former users are dumping it in droves.

Previously gave this app five stars and said it was "perfect in every way". However, they're sunsetting SMS functionality on April 11. At that point I will uninstall the app and use something else. Without cross-platform compatibility, this app is worthless. Signal is making the change because they hold such a dim view of their users that they think we don't understand that SMS messages sent to other people outside Signal aren't secure, which is frustrating.

Signal is removing the one feature that made its platform better than every alternative: opportunistic encryption: I'd go to text someone, discover they're also a Signal user, and be able to message them securely without any extra effort. Without SMS integration, now it's just another proprietary platform that no one uses. Uninstall.

Dropping support for SMS is an own goal that will significantly cut into Signal's user base. I have loved Signal for years and recommended it to many people, but will be using and recommending it a lot less now. Most people care about security but not at the expense of having to use two separate messaging apps. There are significant security costs associated with having SMS on the platform, but appealing to security purists at the cost of usability for most users isn't the wise move.

Signal is a great app, and the only truly encrypted messaging app that will not sell your information to Facebook. But ending support for SMS messages completely ruins it, this app will no longer exist within a year as 100% of it's user base is forced to use something else. Not being able to communicate via SMS is basically not being able to communicate. Really too bad. I wonder who paid them to make that choice.

Great UI and messaging experience, but it has one really staggering flaw: very poor ability to restore message history. When getting a new phone, you can restore history from a backup if you made one -- but only if your new phone has the same operating system (Android or iOS) as the old one. Other devices can be linked to your primary device, but can't access message history, and get disconnected if you change devices. it's just arduous and annoying when I'd rather I could just log in anywhere.

All great things come to an end This is by far the best private messaging application made for iOS or Android. But, since they are now discontinuing support of SMS messages, I can no longer use it as my default replacement for all messages. As a result i will have to be looking for another app to use instead. It is unfortunate because now there is nothing to differentiate Signal from the other encrypted messaging apps available. Would gladly have paid for a version that continued to support SMS

I have been using Signal as my default texting app and would rate it 5 stars, but now they are ending support for regular SMS message delivery. That means I'll have to check some other app for all the people who don't use Signal. I foresee lots of missed texts and lots more inconvenience. SMS integration was one of the best features of Signal compared to other secure messaging apps. Lowering rating to 3 stars.

This app was perfect...right up until it stopped accepting SMS messages. Unfortunately, I talk with too many people, including my landlord, who will not switch to Signal. If I have to use another app for all those people, I might as well use that app alone. So long, Signal. I enjoyed our time together. I wish you all the best, but we are no longer comparable.

ABSOLUTE GARBAGE APP. Transfer function does not work between devices, I lost over 200k messages from across approximately 7 year timespan. App transferred and no longer functions on the old phone, and goes to a black screen that hard locks my phone. Thanks for absolutely nothing and *really* sticking it to us all at the end.

Relatively easy to use/apply. Says it's secure/more secure. I don't know. Can't "see" that far. Don't know what's really going on "behind the curtain". A liitle confusing on how it pulls from and accesses contact file. My friend in th UK seems to be having difficulty making it stick or there is something being lost in translation or not "making a bridge" US to UK. Perhaps. Signal if it is the "best" or one of which most reviewers say it is, should promote the facts and value more. Make familiar
developer_response: You're also welcome to look at Signal's source code directly for yourself and see the continual work that goes into making Signal a better app for you: https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-android

review_description: You used to be able to send regular messages or encrypted ones, in other words this would handle all your messages in one streamlined app. Recently they forced a split between the two so now you have to either use separate apps to handle your messages or you have to be "that guy" and force your friends/family to ALL switch to signal. I've been using this app for I want to say close to 10 years, but I think it may be time to break ties. Shame really.

I have actually been using Signal for a few weeks now as well as I'm truly pleased with the application. It's incredibly simple to make use of - I can swiftly and also conveniently send as well as get messages, participate in HD voice/video calls, and even explore new features. What's likewise terrific is that Signal's advanced privacy-preserving modern technology is always allowed, so I can be sure my discussions are constantly kept personal. On the whole, I'm extremely happy with Signal - it's

Love this app! Simple and lets me stay in touch with friends that care a lot about security. However, it crashes frequently with voice messages and sometimes does not send pictures correctly. (1/14/2022) It crashes less often, however it still does not send photos correctly and now it often fails to send messages. (2 stars) (3/16/2023) Removing SMS was a deal breaker for me. I am not dealing with an app that is less functional than my default messaging app. Sorry, but goodbye! (1 star)

I love how you can see someone typing and whether or not they've received a message, then respond directly to that message. Images/links/videos are clear regardless of compatible phone carriers, and voice memos are fantastic. I haven't experienced ads or glitches - but whenever I make a phone call through signal there's an awful lag with feedback and I hear myself echoed the whole time. Not sure if that's the app or my device. Overall I would highly recommend!

Ultimate privacy! What I like the most is that other users cannot see when you are online or typing and so cannot just bombard you with messages just because you happen to be online or get offended if you don't or delay responding... that is such a huge relief!!!! Also, contacts don't automatically appear on the Signal page. You have the choice to add them there. And then, of course all the privacy features the App provides! No fuss. No frills. Neat, simple, functional. Great App!! Love it!

Really good, great for International calls. I rarely have problems in its current version (none at all I can think of right now) and just works great. sending multiple pictures is a bit odd, if I'm doing it correctly, you initially add one, then have to go back and add the others. not all once.but works great. so thanks for this app and making it freely available.it allowed me to stay in contact with International friends for many years now.

Nice, simple, secure communication with some useful options under the covers. However, the decision to drop SMS (whatever the reasons - I've read the explanation) makes Signal less useful as a default messaging app. So, I have reluctantly moved on to another messaging app that still handles SMS. Signal is now only for communicating with those who use it as their preferred app.

Privacy is pretty great to have in a messaging app. Also, the core messaging features are really good, e.g., the text-to-emote support. As something to address, notifications come quite often a long time after the fact. Thus, you really cannot use Signal to call people. Also, ability to share live location would be nice.

Messages aren't sending and receiving on time. Call notification are delayed at times and sometimes there aren't any notifications at all. Checked other messaging apps and they are working fine. Check the device settings as well and no battery restrictions or battery saver modes are enabled on either end. It's definitely signal and it's server. Far too slow. Fix it or I'm switching.

Stop asking me to rate you! I already did. They should really request for battery optimization to be disabled on install. Consistently Signal somehow is on silent mode and does not ring. I've done everything I can think of. It really is frustrating since it makes it hard to convince others to use it when it's unreliable. Other than that, it's great. There is a difference knowing that you're having a private conversation.

I'm not sure if it's a good messaging app. It doesn't work on an android tablet, and I don't have a lock code for this app on a PC. After a few hours, the program does not synchronize with the device - for example, after deleting a message on the phone, the message will remain on the PC and vice versa. And when sending a video, you cannot turn off the video sound. Sometimes messages are not delivered for no reason - when re-sending, both new and previous messages are sent. After 4 hours, it is n

Generally speaking a great app. I appreciate the end-to-end encryption, the functionality and UI, and the quality of calls. However, I often do not get notified when someone is calling, so I'm constantly missing calls. I've checked my settings and I have notifications on and my phone is not on DND. Hopefully this gets fixed soon as this my, and my family's, preferred method of communication

Has all the features a messaging app needs. It's not perfect for all situations though, but that's mainly due to some creature comforts being incompatible with the focus on security and privacy. For example, there is no web app, only a desktop one, and the possibilities for synchronisation are limited in places. But it's mature, stable, and I can't remember it ever failing, so it's recommended, at least to have available as an option.

As a messaging app, Signal works fine. But the call quality is awful. Sound comes in like waves, you can hear some and then it ebbs and then you hear some. I've tried all the recommended troubleshooting suggested, all the access rights are in order, using latest version and volume is up, tried also with different network connection and am right now believing it to be some kind of a problem with the app itself.

Very mixed feelings. 1) Opening a folder to attach a file takes an eternity. Even with internal storage (no SD card), it takes longer than necessary. 2) The bombardment of notification sounds while a message is unread until opened as well as while you're in a message string and receive a new message. 3) Since transferring from my old phone to the new phone on the same number, the app crashes constantly. Not good enough.

Overall good ap. Wish they didn't change the app as previously, it was the other person's/people's messages that were coloured so that it was easy to keep track of who said what in group chats; now it is your own bubble that is coloured. Also, would be good if there was option to save pictures in bulk from the desktop app. Makes it easier if someone has sent you photos and you want to download.

i like the app i would like to keep it. But i honestly will stop using it once you loose the capacity for standard sms. Its not easy to get people you know to switch to other apps and i can't have 100 of different apps to stay in touch with my friends. Signal was convenient since i'm attempting to use it as much as possible, motivates friends to use it. But the migration was seamless since its also replacing my standard sms apps. Loosing that means the end of it for me.

Ok, so you don't want to support SMS. Ok, fine so don't support it but don't disable it. Many people want this feature. You can provide a option to switch it off and when a user switches it on, you can warn them it is not supported. Just don't annoy everyone. Used to be useful, now a legacy that is itching to be replaced with any any app that will integrate sms and encrypted messages.
developer_response:
You can learn more on why we are doing this in the support page:
https://support.signal.org/hc/articles/360007321171#android_sms

review_description: They killed SMS and the bridge between normal people in the US and privacy advocates. People want less apps and removing SMS means it can't take the place of your SMS app. The SMS export would crash my phone (reboot) if it wasn't plugged in (about 6 months ago my phone would sometimes reboot when Signal received a message) and when complete I found that it mislabeled who said what I'm the imports and it never gave me the option to delete those messages from signal.

Great, free and secure app. 1. I hope they make the video chat functionality better. 2. When a user uninstalls/reinstalls the app, it deletes the history without confirming with the user if they want to keep it. This has damaged a lot of friends trust in the app since history is important! 3. Exporting files/photos is very tedious, I wish they had an option to save to a system folder that is prompted on install.

The absence of a cloud backup feature is disappointing. I moved to a new device and started using Signal as is, all chats empty. A couple days later I read instructions on how to transfer messages from my old phone, did that, and now of course all my new messages are overwritten by the backup. This sucks. I don't have this issue with Telegram, because it let's me store backups in a cloud so transferring to a new device is less manual effort.

Messages cannot be sent if you go to another app/turn off your phone while they are being sent. It is nearly impossible to share multiple photos to Signal - there's always an error message. Even sending a singular photo from Signal select bar fails 3/10 times. These points make using the app really annoying at times.

Removal of sms and support is the wrong way to go. I've been using this app for the past 5 years or so and I'm disappointed in the regular glitches that have been happening since this announcement. Stickers and stories are the least of my concerns-I was using this as my default messaging app. With the changes, and the lack of transition of data across the account (the data instead only transfers onto the device) I'm uninstalling today.

Nice app however I am not notified when people are calling and also messages don't come through unless I open the particular conversation. I am missing calls and not able to see texts. Also my messages don't go through except after a while or when the person opens the conversation. Hopefully this will be fixed soon. Edit: I am missing more and more calls and messages. This needs to be fixed hopefully

I would very much appreciate an alternative to WhatsApp. Unfortunately it happens often enough that my friends or me are not being notified after receiving a message. This is a deal breaker. I did all the exhausting troubleshooting you recommend on your website. My Signal app remains unreliable. Notifications are a feature that should work out of the box. I shouldn't have to perform a 20-step troubleshooting process to hopefully receive messages in the future.

I've been using Signal for the past couple months, in order to swith from WeChat because I dont want the chinese guys to process my data anymore ). Overall is pretty simple straight forward light app, with all the basic features you need from a messaging/calling app. Runs smoothly so far. The fact that it store data only on my device (and the other person's I text to) is the number one! And even it might not seem perfect for some, I appreciate the team behind it I thank you guys for your work.

It used to be my favourite sms messaging app with the great option to send encrypted messages to other users who have it installed. Since only 10% of my contacts use Signal there is no need for me to use it anymore since it dropped sms support. Very bad decision! I was very happy with it's functionality as a hybrid messaging app. Very simple to understand the open-lock/closed-lock send button, no idea why it would be confusing for anyone. üòî

Signal is so much better than WhatsApp because it works for colour blind people as you can change the settings, you have a password so it is way more secure, it asks you to enter your password every so often once logged on so you don't forget it and you can send storys to individual groups and people rather than just to everyone pluse it asks you to customise who you send it to every time but you can save a setting if you don't want it different everytime. The best part is THERE ARE NO ADS.

I've been using it for a long time now. I haven't had any problems. Wish i could send more than one picture at a time. I plan to start using it more now instead of WhatsApp to protect my private information. I haven't been able to send video clips. March '23 I really liked the privacy of the app in the beginning etc... but now that the sms is gone it makes some things hard. Having to talk to use 2 apps instead one to text someone isn't ease. Stars have to be lowered. :(

Great sound quality for calling. For some reason I can't get audible notifications with this app, even though everything is enabled, both in the app, and on my phone. The notification dot that appears on the app icon is barely noticable, as well.

I support Signal, and I've done monthly donations for years. But the end of the support of SMS is infuriating. My family and friends were using the tool as their default application to communicate. Now, they've got to figure if the recipient of the message use Signal to select the right application. They are basically all migrating to Google Message, which also handles end to end encryption.

Disappointed to see that Signal will be removing SMS support, from a country where SMS is used by almost everyone, it's convienent to have everything in one application, and honestly I'll probably end up using other platforms if this is the case, due to the already higher market share. Signal is great, I've rarely had issues and it has been constantly improving for years now.

I love the privacy aspect of the app, but for the past many months I don't get any notifications regarding calls or messages until I open the app, which defeats the whole point of having it. I have tried all sorts of trouble shooting and it is definitely not my phone/battery/data usage/notifications settings. I wonder if there is some incompatibility with Samsung OS..

It was a great app, it allowed you to have secure messages with other people who have the app, but also normal SMS messages with other people, without having 2 different apps. Now that they're removing SMS support it has lost all appeal, it's just a simple messages app like a lot of others. Except that it also has stories, which is the most useless thing. So if you're looking for an app that does everything this isn't it, and if you're looking for a simple message app this isn't it either.

Removal of SMS is bad. I can count on 1 hand the number of people I regularly contact who use Signal. It was great when they did, but the primary usage for me was SMS. Now I have to go back to switching between apps. Might as well delete it. Just because we can switch, and have been for other apps, doesn't make it ok. I want less apps, not more

Signal is a secure messaging app with end-to-end encryption and no data storage. It's updated frequently, and the desktop app is convenient. However, its design is still outdated compared to other messaging apps, but gets better with each update. Overall, it's a good option for privacy-conscious users.

Clunky rubbish, which I continue to use. Excellent app from a privacy point of view, but can no longer be recommended as it will no longer be a drop in replacement for the SMS app. The development team is fixated on adding useless garbage such as stories and shitcoin payments. Also, the message backup feature is quite limited - you can only restore your messages on another Android. High risk of losing your message history.

I had a problem with one contact not receiving texts through Signal. I knew something was wrong, because messages would immediately check as sent, when other contacts have a delay while being sent. I tried uninstalling the app and installing again, but none of my texts were restored. Had to restore a backup. But my 1st problem persists. + Signal will no longer support SMS, it is not practical to use this app any longer. I can't convert the world to Signal, and I want to use only one texting app.

Signal is very good. I prefer it over more commonly used messenger apps. The interface is uncluttered & doesn't weave itself through your OS. The biggest attraction for me, other messenger services are vulnerable. Signal does a good job at resolving these issues & as long as they stick to the double ratcheting end-to-end encryption thats only viewable to the poster & receiver... it will remain my go-to messenger service. Don't screw it up.

Everything in order: clear UI, fast communication. No bugs/glitches/crashes experienced so far. I was not digging deeper, so can't tell anything about what's "under the hood" (regarding the handling of actual communication). Good security vs ease-of-use ratio for normies at least concerned with their online privacy. Cheers!

Overall a decent app, a little flaky at times with notifications but generally solid and I've long been an advocate. Sadly, the decision to drop SMS support effectively makes the service useless as a hub for device communication. I'll be looking for an alternative. While I hope it's actually for privacy reasons the whole debacle leaves a sour taste and feels more like preparation for a cynical grab at market share.

Excellent program. We use it for work group chats and it's pretty much the only good solution. I also use it personally for long distance messaging out of country. Also excellent for this. The fact that videos and pictures are full resolution makes life so much better that it's my go to for everything. This app improves our business, our lives.

Began adding lots of superficial features such as stickers and 'story time' that I find useless, and with the announcement that they'll be dropping SMS support I no longer see the point of Signal for the average user. Barely anyone in my contacts list uses the app so it's not worth keeping as an encrypted messenger. On exporting messages to a new app I chose to delete the SMS from Signal, leaving me with 3 'conversations' (one of which was Signal advertising new features). That says it all.

Used to be very easy to onboard new tech-lite users. With the removal of SMS support getting non-technical folks to use 2 apps to talk to me is difficult, if not impossible. I would love to keep using signal for all my messages, but the removal of SMS has caused my signal enabled contact list to shrink drastically. Soon I'll be the only one in my contacts still using the app.

I originally gave Signal 5* because it really was an excellent app. However the thing I prized most was the ability to have encrypted and unencrypted messages in the same app. That simplified my life and made it easier to recruit more people to the app because it wouldn't complicate their lives. Now that Signal no longer supports SMS, I have to remove 3*.

Customer service sucks. I accidentally deleted all my messages (several years' worth of messages), but had done a backup a few days before. But the steps on their website to restore using a backup didn't work. I reached out to Signal for help and they sent me the same page from the website I said I already looked at. I said that didn't work and still needed help and they've ignored my attempts to contact them for weeks now. Plus it's only useful if other people have Signal since they removed SMS

Dear Signal team, I would like to highlight the new update is quite irritating. Every time I have to switch for earphone option otherwise It won't connect to earphone automatically. Kindly fix it. Otherwise the app is quite awesome in terms of videocall and audiocall quality and the UI is also nice. Thanks.

The amount of Spam and creepy advertising using this app eliminates should be all that is needed for a review. I could go on and on about the instances with side-by-side comparisons. However, I'll just tell you to look up the story behind this App. Simply superb!

I have been using signal since two years. Till now I haven't faced any problems but recently from a month before the messages are not delivering in time and I'm receiving messages from others lately. The message delivery is too late even with proper internet connection the messages are not delivering and I'm unable to receive messages in time. Kindly look forward for this problem. I love this app personally! I hope u will fix this as soon as possible. Thank you

Hello, with your last update there are some issue mainly with the new feature of redirecting sound when a headset being connected and by which if your earphone get disconnected and you are in call it will automatically end the phone call which is really annoying, and for the rotation of screen too there are some issue, kindly revert back the proper settings for a good user experience thank you very much

great app. amazing chat/group text features and so useful. but I have some feature requests even though I already used the feature request in app. the note to self is the best feature of the app by the way and keep up the good work. my requests are: 1) I would like to be able pin more than 4 Chats/groups 2) I would like to be able to sort/rearrange pinned chats.

I recently changed phones. When I downloaded the app, it kept giving me the message "unable to connect to service." Even when I tried to transfer my old account, it would still give me the same message. Even worse, if I try to connect more than once, my account gets locked and I have to try again in 3 or 4 hours. Very frustrating!

I like just about everything about how Signal works. Great for sending text or images between my devices, just as easy for sending same to friends, without the random delays and 'spam' errors of email. And of course the privacy aspect is valuable. Lately notifications have become unreliable on both phone and Windows 10 PC. Not sure why.

No annoying ads and reassuringly secure. The problem is I have to open signal to get new messages to come through. Not particularly helpful for work or family life. I used to donate money to Signal because it seemed like the answer i was looking for, but these problems are pretty fundamental flaws. I'm now considering deleting the app due to its inability to notify me of messages. People are now calling me instead which doesn't work for me either!
developer_response: Sorry to hear that. After updating to the latest version, is this still an issue? Please write to us from the in-app option. Go to Signal Settings (profile), Help, Contact us. Make sure to include the debug log and tell us about what is going on.

review_description: Generally it's pretty good,but frustrating when you're typing a reply, get a new message and the text you were typing gone.....too many taps to insert an image and the stickers are pretty useless,confusing when you wanna insert a gif etc but your typing the Search in the Android keyboard,you have to make sure you're typing in the correct search box

Messages always send but never get delivered for like 25 minutes, a lot of the time. It would be nice if the flashlight stayed on when recording like it does on snapchat, as it only enables when taking pictures, not videos Videos recorded with signal are frozen on the screen for the first 2-3s

I will sing the praises of signal forever. Just note that it dropped an occasional SMS when I used it for texting. It's good at everything else + ad-free. Real privacy, audio notes, video chat, disappearing messages.

Messages aren't sending and receiving on time! This is since 3 days. It's getting annoyed because sometimes it takes more than a day before the messages are sending. Signal your server has problems! Do something about it.

Signals greatest strength was, in my opinion, SMS support. It allowed people to simply install Signal on their less tech savvy relatives phones as the default SMS app and they'd get secure communication for free when both parties had it. Now they will simply default back to insecure communication because you aren't going to teach them to use multiple apps when they just want to "send a message". I barely have contacts on Signal now and I really have to reevaluate if it's worth keeping at all.

I was looking for a better app than Telegram and Whatsapp and this it it. It's lightweight, secure and fast. Very quick and easy, simple Interface, dark mode, doesn't take 10 minutes to load like telegram. All good. The only feature that it's missing is sending silent messages that telegram has and I think it's really useful. Hope they add it eventually.

Since the latest FORCED update, earlier this year, this app has had 1 main irritant/bug; replies to my message don't come through until AFTER I've sent ANOTHER reply myself, THEN it instantly appears BELOW my reply. It's not a constant issue but it happens multiple times every day. The app worked fine BEFORE this FORCED update. ü§∑üèª I've even manually updated to the latest version but, the issue is still there, exactly as it's been for the last few weeks. Hoping it'll be fixed ASAP..... ü§ûüèª

I've was happy with Signal until I switched from iPhone XR to Samsung S23+. Now I don't get any visual notification for new messages, I have to remember to open the app and check if there is a message. I use Signal to stay in touch with my brother who won't use any other apps. We live in different time zones and I don't want to be woken in the middle of the night so I have disabled the sound. Any suggestions for how to fix this would be welcome, please.

Dropped to one star for adding a drop down that bizarrely, and stupidly, tells me I'm looking at today's messages. Every moment online, we're inundated with popups, popdowns, slidey things that keep things in our faces constantly. Despicable thing to do to people in a messaging app.

No Android to iPhone backup-restore system, my girlfriend has technically lost access to all of our messages. Seems like such a simple fix, I'm sure it's more difficult than it seems, but this is partially why barely anyone uses Signal in my circle. Problematic, unreliable, at least it looks okay and encrypts messages (good for 420?). Not the best platform for general messaging, it's closer to a "meh". Also it's not available on tablets... and messages occasionally fail to deliver... convincing.

I used to love this app and would of given it a 4 or 5 star review before they discontinued the SMS feature, which used to make it an excellent all round messaging app. While signal messaging is secure, you can only use it if your contact has also signed up for the app. And most people haven't. So it's rendered fairly useless most of the time. I'll keep it for a little while longer for the whole 4 people I know that's stayed with Signal. Everyone else I know left when SMS stopped.

This app was excellent. It was the best messaging app out there. Keyword "was". Now they're removing SMS support, so you will need two apps to flip between depending on who you're messaging. I don't want to juggle yet another messaging app, so RIP Signal. Hopefully they are smart enough to revert this myopic decision.

Sms support is removed. It's great for encrypted messaging, but I liked it because I could use it to both send encrypted messages, and talk to my friends and family who don't use or know about signal (plus the ui looks great). Not everyone I talk to uses signal, and I don't like using multiple messaging apps, so due this change, signal will be one of those apps I rarely use if at all, and it will be much harder to convince someone to use signal if it means they can only use it to talk to me.

I've used Signal for years and it's been great. I've been about to send end-to-end encrypted messages with a traditional SMS fallback for people not using the app. With their recent changes to Signal they're removing the ability to send standard SMS through their app, sighting that having any insecure messaging fallback isn't what they're focused on. The expectation is to get everyone on secure messages, that's just not feasible and neither is using two messenger apps. Extremely disappointed

very good app! the only feature i would appreciate a lot would be to tag chats or create folders to make them easier to sort through. if you're in lots of different groupchats around one topic, it would be amazing to be able to tag them all as the same colour or something and sort by colour, just to make it easier to keep track of everything.

This app is amazing, it serves its purpose being very well private in every sense. Very accessible and flexible features and all, I just love it but I believe voice notes should be worked on so we are Abel to pause and continue voice notes and also post voice notes on our status...I strongly believe these are the only edges lacking, aside these it's the best private messaging app ever.

I used to love and praise Signal, and was were pleased with it's functions. However, removing SMS support turns this to yet another messaging app that divides people instead of offering a single app that works for every contant. Such a sad direction Signal's heading- instead of standing out as the perfect messaging app, it will just blend in with others.

Easy to message and make calls. Connecting to the internet haven't been a problem. Connections are generally clear. The navigation can be difficult. The settings are not descriptive. For instance, how do you set the sounds for an individual caller. The

We really like Signal. It's an excellent application for connecting safely with loved ones who are spread around the world. The app is free and also there are no ads. You can additionally use Signal to make high-quality voice as well as video clip phone calls. The application is continuously progressing, with new attributes included all the time.

I'm using Signal for several years now and never had any problems. Clean UI, clean UX. Great messenger with a great feature set and great implementation. Other than Threema or its fork Session, Signal is inevitably bound to a phone number. But that's no criticism, just information.

I left WhatsApp because it required access to all my contacts for use. There seemed something wrong about giving up my friend's names and numbers. This app requests the same access. You can prevent it on Android but it constantly asks for access every time you attempt to message a new contact. Friends on Iphones have to yield all their contacts before completing registration. What is the deal with this? Why do all these messenger apps default to scavenging contacts lists?

Can't send large video files, huge battery drain when video calling, can't delete all messages or even the ones you want to delete after a certain amount of time. WhatsApp is way better in doing all of these things. Audio does not work on video calls sometimes now.

Signal seems to be the solution for Android users looking for a secure, private messaging app that can take the place of SMS. I really like it. Update: it's no longer an Android SMS substitute, unfortunately. Still a great app.

Bubbles are just a bad idea. Just use notifications, they work. Provide a way for users to know if another contact even uses the app. Maybe with a bounce message. Many users stop using Signal, but appears as if they get the message. Unreliable comsec. iPhone users are usually the problem for some reason. ü§∑

Sending video file more than 100mb fails. It does not auto compress videos to a smaller chunk or fails or convert. It is starting to hamper how I use this app since all other similar apps do not hv this issue. Signal Support's response was to send smaller file. Not for newer phones that can capture higher res videos.

Great privacy app. Good thing about Signal is I believe it looks for a Wi-Fi connection before even going to Cellular. So if you're in an area where you don't have good cell signal but have a hotspot you can still make and receive private encrypted video calls and texts.

It does everything I need! Only reservation I have is trying to delete is tedious. Don't want to set a timed auto delete as sometimes I need to reread later. However when doing a general cleanup of chats it seems to require each entry deletes individually. Otherwise a good app.

UPDATE April 2023: Call quality now BETTER THAN CELL SERVICE, but not as reliable unless you're on WiFi. Can port your account so those changes deserve a half star more. FROM 2019: Excellent on privacy, not so great on call quality. Also, at some point in the last year notifications changed, and now half my friends don't know they have a message, which makes it less useful as a communication tool. Still, better than telling everybody your personal business, like other apps *cough* FB.

Literally pulling code from a popular feature such as native sms support seems insane to me, and I'm far from alone in thinking this. There is no reason why sms and signal messages cannot appear in the same app and not have separated areas. It is a little bit of work, sure, but many of us have external contacts that are not on signal that have no reason to be signal contact. Now we all have to search for a product that is not only *less* secure but also far less convenient!

I would've given it a 5-star if it provided the ability to export your chat/messages onto a file that can later be imported to the app, to continue your conversations on other devices regardless of OS. This is a HUGE issue that I hope gets addressed in future updates.

Love this messenger app over any other at the moment. The only gripe I have is that when recording videos throught this app, the zoom options is not something this app allows. The recording immediately stops. Other than that, I really like the app.

Used to work well but is now extremely bug ridden since recent updates making the app impossible to use. Issues include the option to swap headphones is hidden, swapping to wired headphones crashes the app, receive consecutive error messages asking for the cache to be cleared & random app shutdowns.

Doing well with this app so far . But having trouble receiving and sending. Receiving its not connecting .I have a Excellent connection. To wifi so maybe one of the boys can come by an take a look . So many did not sends . Would be 5 star that was fixed . So hopefully I'm updating this post
always stuck on single tick. Especially when during emergency times. Messages don't get through, and if/when they do, have to wait till other party goes on the app itself to receive the messages.

No longer getting notifications. Checked every setting in app and on my phone, there's no issues. Cleared cache, nothing. No updates for app. Battery background setting is not restricted. Background data usage is on. Nothing else I can do. Please fix.

Signal may be encryption secure but it misses two very important screen security features - 1) delete for all participants in a conversation & 2) an immediate delete all option for a conversation (Telegram has these as standard). Developers need to get onto these deficiencies ASAP. We live in dangerous times in HK.

Quite often there are big delays in receiving messages. Calls sometimes will ring on my phone but not received on remote side. Unfortunately very unreliable. Also uses up a lot of memory. On the phone and PC.

love this messenger! but often i don't see others messages until hours after they were sent n vice versa. sometimes sent messages disappear entirely. please fix this!! also i would love it if sent videos wouldn't get downsized so that the quality gets significantly worse. thanks!!

Wrost update ü§¨üò°ü§¨üëéüëéüëé Its speaker turns on automatically when making and recive a video call. The option to change audio mode is automatically hidden. If you have to make a video call late at night and put it on the speaker repeatedly, tell me how it is correct. While 3.5 headphones would have already been insert. Get it right quickly. I m facing prob..

Theres still no obvious way to forward posts to other platforms or delete multiple conversations without deleting everything like in a comparable app! This definitely needs more development for ease of use. Otherwise it's fine although I also found inputting my story also somewhat awkward.

It's fine until you have to reset your phone, because then you lose every single conversation history, your groups, everything. So be sure not to have any important or emotional conversations here that you might want to keep. They only last as long as Signal does on your phone.

This was the best sms app ever with a bonus of extra features and security when texting other's with the same app. The easiest part of selling other people on this app was that it integrated smoothly with your normal SMS while providing all the mentioned extra features. Now it's more like using a featureless version of Telegram or Whatsapp. In summary: this app used to make security accessible for the average user. Now it's something only to be used when really necessary.

I literally use this app to stay in touch with one friend, but I so enjoy it! And so far no issues, although when I reinstalled it after a while as I had a new phone, there seemed to be no way to recover old messages sadly.

Interesting corporate suicide. Why an app would decide to alienate the entire US customer base so they could better compete with the big baddies on the thing the company cares about, at the cost of an enormous chunk of the userbase. The goal was admirable, the chosen means to achieve this goal were drawn in crayon and smeared with drool. Dumbest thing I have ever seen in this space, which is a mouthful, and the doubling down by the devs is a spectacle to behold.

Encrypted text and calling app... good functionality, no ads... what's not to like? The only thing it lacks is the ability to call or text a regular number, but of course then you would lose the encryption. Still, it would be nice if you could do it. Other than that (reason for 4 stars) small thing, it's perfect.

App works best with Google play service disabled as google play service now has hidden device admin creditals, when enabled gogole overwrites Signals screen protect software that blocks screen shots. Signal is a great privacy tool! With Google Play services disabled. It's a smple few steps to enable Google play service when you need the app store, go into settings type app and your sure to fined it easily . Since Android 10 your Carrier (ISP) gets a lot of accesses including some remote acces

I uninstalled to make space and it DELETED ALL MY TEXT MESSAGES!! ALL OF THEM. Worried that soon the app will force me to update to fix some bug that I don't care about, but I'll be out of space on my phone. Not a fan of forced upgrades. Latest forced upgrade lets me avoid AM or PM. But I can no longer use the app without upgrading. After several minutes it asks me which apps I would like to remove so that I can upgrade. I don't want to delete any of them.

Was a great app. Used it for years. Now useless for me now that SMS functionality has been removed. It's unnecessary overhead to have to use multiple apps when wanting to send a message and remembering who has Signal and who doesn't. Can't believe there wasn't a UX solution for indicating whether a message was encrypted or plain old SMS.

I have had few problems and love the majority of features, and a secure app that isn't monetizing you is a godsend. That said, it has been announced that Signal is dropping SMS support. I can't use it past that point. Most use cases make this a dealbreaker. It was a good ride, I guess.

I've been using signal for 100% of my texts since 2014. With the announcement of no more more standard texting it will likely fall to less than 5%. Of my friends that I convinced to jump on (literally dozens), 90% will uninstall and that remaining 10% will still likely text me on standard, unencrypted apps most of the time. This app was great because I could text anyone regardless of what app they were using, but if they start using signal it would be encrypted. Most people don't want two apps

Signal has delivered consistent quality since the day I installed it (probably over two years ago now maybe?). I'm kinda disappointed they dropped SMS support but it's core purpose, secure communications has always been delivered. Easy to use, no hacky features, nothing but an app fulfilling the purpose it was built for and consistency. Thank you devs for the hard work you've put into Signal over the years!

Dropped a star because it seems more often than not now that my messages don't come through without opening the app. Even my pc version has stopped giving notifications. It's the only app on my phone that won't use the notification light too. Its a good app but this problem is extremely itirating. Dropped another star because its getting worse. Messages not sending, no notifications and on both pc and mobile. I love signal but I'm going to be taking a break from it soon due to this.

It was alright before they had been intentionally dumping SMS messages. Won't be using it as my default messaging app going forward and won't be supporting them financially or recommending the app anymore. Support reporting feeds you into an endless loop where they just tell you to update (even though it's current) and you can get no further. Used to be ok. Removing SMS support is going to drive a lot of users away - its a bad move on an already flawed app

Loved using signal as my default message app, but since SMS has been dropped, there is little use for it. EVERYONE has WhatsApp, and there is little incentive to ditch it other than Android users being able to use Signal as the SMS app combined. If I have to use 2 apps, it might aswel be SMS and WhatsApp.

After April 11th update, the audio device switching is showing problem. I like to use my wired IEMs and now it's horrible. Never thought plugging and unplugging the IEMs won't be recognized by the app... Please look into this.

It's the nr 1 messenger. With a problem of messages not received by anybody despite battery optimizations. Also 98% calls simply fail despite "ringing". It actually doesn't work for years. Bad developments historically were: - removal of browser app - start voice call confirmation button - kill sms messages (really?? It was protected!!!!!)

Removed SMS - just wanted to reply to an SMS on my phone, which was configured how I wanted it with Signal as my SMS client. Now need to stuff around with finding and evaluating an alternative SMS app that supports importing messages from Signal rather than the original task of sending a message. The IT industry has completely lost the plot with continuous integration and deployment.

Used this app for years and recommended it to my friends and family. Unfortunately, with the removal of SMS, I've had to switch back to Google SMS. The ease of access to have both in one app far surpasses whatever moral code you feel is being upheld. Please, listen to your user base and revert this change

I really appreciate what this app aims to do, and I've found it to be very user-friendly! I'm sad about the decision to drop SMS integration. I understand the decision, but it's hard to convince everyone I want to talk to to make the switch. I was hoping to have only one or two apps for chatting, but I guess I'll have to go back to also using my onboard SMS app for most text messaging.

I love this app and I love that I feel secure and safe not just from people but also from prying authorities who unjustly poke their nose in people's business. One thing I would like to see happen is the option to not allow screenshots you would think that that would apply towards the other party that you're sending message to but it seems that it only works for my messages so I can't take a screenshot which is so backwards. Please fix this.

I love the app. It's open source, secure and looks sleek. But since the last month it has been a pain to use. The mesages do not get delivered on time. And this happens eay too frequently. I have a pretty stable internet connection, so that's not the issue. I receive messages late too. Also, when I use the desktop app this issue is not there. Please fix this. The app has become unusable.

Really good, secure messaging app option. Probably the best. Lots of good improvements in recent history, including timed messages which I've been asking for. Still would like to see an option to run on ARM Chromebooks and an option to use it without having to have a phone number.
With every update Signal is getting slower and more bloated with superficial functions and animations. It's a shame to see the direction in which the product is going.

Signal no longer locks at all, doesn't follow its own settings, doesn't follow phone lock settings... It's privacy is broken when the app can only be locked when prompted to lock it, automatic locking is a fail, has been for a while. Get the basic right, and no I don't need any app to manage money and payments for me, and I don't care about stories.

The app doesn't run well for me at the moment. Currently running on a Pixel4a (Android 13) The input lag when messaging is getting pretty bad. Updated and still lagging. I've just cleared storage and cache will see if that helps. ü§ûI had to remove and reinstall. Now, camera control is lacking when rotating the phone.

When someone calls me I only find out about it if I go to the app and check for messages, which could be hours after the attempted call. It will rarely give a notification of an incoming call. EDIT: I wrote that review some time ago and the service has improved immensely since then. It's a great app, very reliable. Thanks!

Bye, Signal. For the past year this has been my go-to app. It was genuinely the best messaging app I had found, and as a bonus my messages to others with Signal were encrypted! Now that I can no longer send SMS messages to those without it though, it's become useless. Guess it's Google Messages for me now- if your goal was to drive people back into the arms of Big Tech, you've succeeded. What an awful decision. I had considered donating, now I'm glad I didn't

Was a fantastic messaging platform for multiple protocols until they decided to carve out sms/mms. They can have whatever justification they want, problem is that wasn't the use case of the app when I signed up. They are taking a page out of Googles playbook, removing functionality and forcing users into a proprietary ecosystem. Guess it's time to find another secured messaging app that can also do SMS/mms.

The added security makes it a little difficult to use sometimes. I bought a new phone and most applications that I backed up on the old phone were restored to the new phone and worked just fine, except for Signal. Something didn't transfer. I had too follow some sort of ancient ritual before I could see my old friends, chats, and group conversations. I was freaking the ef out until I got those back.

I've been using Signal for years and then you finally enabled group voice and video chats which is great for organizing. But now you want to get rid of SMS messaging which is ridiculous. I use the app for all my messages and there is no practical point to stop SMS messages. You're allowing phone service companies to transmit our msgs will result in less privacy which is antithetical to the reason Signal exists.

This was an excellent do-all secure messaging app. Allowed me to have secure conversations with other Signal users but could also handle unsecure messaging from others, and would allow me to use some of Signal's internal labeling and muting features even on non-Signal contacts. I won over a lot of Signal converts over the years with the above sales pitch, and feel a bit betrayed now it's taking a huge step backwards and becoming Just Another 3rd Party Messaging App by removing SMS compatibility.

I love this app. It's such a refreshing experience compared to other similar apps. You get the security and privacy you want, neat looking and well made interface, all the the features you need and no unnecessary ones. Okay, maybe stories are not neccessary in messaging app, but I don't mind it as long as it's not intrusive. Really great instant messaging app! Keep up the good work!

It was fine until my work consolidated multiple accounts into one after acquisitions. Now, the app is constantly crashing. I can't have it open for more than a minute before it closes with no warning at all. No error messages, no crash reporting, just suddenly I'm staring at whatever was open last. I'm lucky if I can even send a single message. Very disappointed.
developer_response: Hi there, we're very sorry for the trouble. When you have a moment, please navigate to your app's "You" tab > "Preferences" > "Send Feedback" to flag this with our support team and provide some logs we'll need to investigate. We'll be happy to help!

review_description: No longer functional. Used to be pretty great with a few minor quirks but now I can rarely open a message, thread, or channel without extremely odd dysfunction and completely incorrect mapping.
