It is a good app and if you want to add music to videos it is great for that but it does crash sometimes and it is a little annoying to try to save it but if you want something done quick, this might not be the app for you. It takes at least 5 minutes to compress videos together.
Very nice üëå and good for uploading videos nice apps

Reddit, please fix your app. The video player isn't a dealbreaker, but it's very annoying that I have to leave and come back just to fix the video player. Also, I keep experiencing this glitch where I would tap a post, and it would take me to a completely different post. It's very annoying, and resetting the app usually doesn't fix it. I shouldn't have to do magic tricks just to view posts and videos.

You seriously can't fix one issue for making two more. Here's a radical thought for the UI team, but when I hit the back button several times on the home screen of an app, instead of infinitely refreshing the home screen (which is a terrible base design choice for the back button anyway when it *is* working as intended to refresh once and keep people on the app forever), how about just QUITTING THE STUPID APP!!!

When clicking on an image or video, the comments will appear as a full menu rather than a sliding menu to access the video quickly. For videos, it'll display as a smaller playback in the bottom left, which serves no purpose unless you want to read comments while simultaneously watching the video. Please revert the change, it's awful.

Downloading images still doesn't work properly after over 2 years of this issue being a thing. You usually have to wait a little bit or just restart your device for it to show up in your gallery. And when it finally does, it isn't even the right folder. It makes a new one called "pictures". This has gone on for years and you haven't put any effort into fixing it

It has gotten slower and less user-friendly over the years. It crashes significantly more after the latest updates than it used to, just from browsing posts. Scrolling past a playing video will keep it playing (sometimes even looping), this includes ads. Despite this app taking up a large chunk of my free time. I'd still give it 0 stars, the time given hinges solely on the community content

The app got worse. Features keep disappearing, the video player refuses to play videos, and the one tap controls everything in a thread. They added a read-only portion for posts for a week, then took it away. Trending topics is gone now, too. One tap is all it takes to show a spoiler, but it's going to close the comment it's in. The same goes for links in a comment, too. It seems the app keeps changing for the sake of change, and it's annoying.

Every update, something else messes up. For the past few days, my chats won't show. It hid the chats I had and would only show one out of the three (even though I was still getting notifications for the others). I get notifications for chat requests but can't see them. For whatever reason, a few have been able to go through recently, but it's still bugging too much

Used to love browsing on my phone but for about 3 months or more now the app just. Sucks. It won't load subs/posts I click of for at least 3 minutes or more and that's connected to wifi. It doesn't matter if I just opened the app or have had it open for a while. Idk what happened but it doesn't seem like it's getting a fix any time soon.

Incredible how one of the most active media sites on earth has one of the worst apps I've ever seen. Constantly buggy and slow with a terrible video player. They often change features with no options to have it the old way. Not to mention one of my accounts appears to always be on a separate version of the app despite being on the same device.

The app is a unstable and buggy mess. At a baseline, about a fifth of embedded media posts don't load. But there still appears to be a memory leak, as extended use will always result in load times slowing until the entire app crashes. After the most recent updates, the app has only gotten worse. Now trying to reveal a spoiler on a comment also collapses said comment, which resets the spoiler thus making the text impossible to read. Additionally, posting auto duplicates itself a half dozen times.

It's okay. Struggles to open links in other apps like it's supposed to when you turn off supported links. Video player is obnoxious with no volume control. UPDATE: Now they put a pop-up to ruin your screenshots. You can close the pop-up immediately to stop it, but you have to every time. IT'S OBNOXIOUS.

The app has been getting increasingly buggy. Go to open a post and an entirely different one will open sometimes. Often it takes trapping a post twice to get it to open, then you have to "close it" twice. Can no longer toggle spoilered text - attempting to will collapse the comment, and expanding re-obscures the text. Very frustrating experience on mobile, and it seems the issues never get resolved, just more new ones getting added.

Mobile app is horrible, constantly buggy, videos won't play half the time, or the comment won't load in (even though my internet is working fine and other social media apps are running smoothly). It's been like this for years but has gotten progressively worse (somehow?). It's irritating that such a popular social media platform would have an app that runs properly like 40% of the time.

Strangely when I click on posts now it's been taking me back to the front page from about a month ago. I can't explain why this is happening. I edited my review. The app no longer allows you to filter the front page. You can only filter the home page and even then it's buried. UI/UX has taken a hit.

For quite a few months now, loading new posts and comments has been broken. Posts don't load when you tap them, and scrolling down to load posts takes doesn't load new posts. Opening subreddits just opens a blank page with a spinning reddit loading logo. Opening a post does the same, or it doesn't even register that you tapped the post, until you end up tapping a video to watch, then 3 minutes later the post loads with the video and audio playing in the background. This has been many months now.

As of a recent update, tapping anywhere on a reply will now collapse it, but for some reason this also happens if you tap on a link or a spoiler. It's not a huge deal for links because they still open, but it is a big deal for spoilers because they re-hide when you collapse the reply. Also, load times are still very high sometimes, which ruins the flow of using the app. Across the website and the app, my profile picture gets cropped strangely despite being a perfect square.

This thing became a broken mess in the past year. You open the app, or a subreddit, or a post to look at comments and it just sits there loading, doing nothing. Bad. I know it's doing nothing, because the desktop site, or even going to the same post on the mobile browser loads the same post or page instantly. It's very frustrating to use, because it looks better than the other apps, and when it does work, it's easier to use than the mobile browser. Then it goes right back to being sooo slooow.

This app is a mess. Half the time the comments won't load and the videos won't play. Or the comments will load but then they go away when I make the video full screen and can't get them to come back. Also, videos will play randomly while I'm reading another post I have opened. Videos play when they shouldn't. Sometimes I'll click to close a comment thread, then something opens in a web browser.

No where close to how it used to be. The app is not very customizable and the constant changes of your own profile links from the left side to the right is annoying. Getting constant ads about creating an avatar every time you opened the app for the last year has been infuriating. Too many ads mixed in your feed and one of the latest updates doesn't keep videos at the top of the post while looking at comments.

The content can be good, but the app needs work, the video player is garbage and they just keep making it worse, in fact many things don't load often, on top of customizability being garbage. Now they've recently made it so you can't swipe through the pop feed, you have to tap to open it then close it again and then go to the next post and then open that one, where previously you could just swipe through. 3/10 had potential but they seem hellbent on ruining it, still use it every day tho XD

Normally enjoy Reddit and have had few issues with the app. But then they updated it and made it worse. Every video is now a tiny, unwatchable, super small, floating picture-in-picture window, whenever you feel like reading the comments. Kind of defeats the point of reddit. Having the video on top, while being able to scroll the comments below was a much better design. I hope this gets fixed soon

Horribly buggy. Often freezes and/or crashes. Sometimes, clicking on any post will consistently lead to some unrelated post. Scrolling randomly becomes disabled. Repeatedly shows content from random subs, despite telling the app to stop. I have to come back to this review every once in a while to add another issue: now, I can't view any sibreddits. This app is absolute garbage - try to find alternatives. Finally, Reddit ads are disguised as posts and often carry misinformation.

Latest update is missing the option to add flair to a post. Also missing the cursor in dark mode. Overall pretty decent, but the auto-refresh in the feed is a bit frustrating. I wish I could turn it off. Devs are so-so at responding to issues. Sometimes fast, sometimes oblivious for weeks at a time.

I have lightning fast internet speed but for some reason I'm having issues with videos buffering a lot or not even playing at all. Also some of the pictures won't open for me when I touch the screen. I'll have to take a screen shot just so that I can zoom in. I enjoy the app but these issues need to be fixed.

Lately the app has had serious trouble loading on my android. It'll just load the first 10 posts but won't let me open any of them for about 10 minutes of the app being open. It's honestly ridiculous, it happens every single day I open the app. Absolute garbage. Editing this review down to a 1 star. Maybe 2-3 times a year, Reddit changes how you scroll through the app, and it's never in a good way. Stop making me relearn muscle memory to use your app that doesn't work half the time.

They manage to find a way to make it worse with every update, I swear. Bugs are still present that have been around since 2018. It consistently takes so long to open a thread that you can look around at other posts while you're waiting. And god forbid you try and switch to a different app for longer than 2 seconds. You'll be met with a black screen, and wait even longer for the thread you were reading to reopen. Poor/useless/unnecessary UI updates are also made frequently.

I've primarily used the app for a year and it's awful. Navigation is odd and clunky, if you let it give suggestion notifications there's no clean way to navigate back and forward. To get back to your feed, you have to click into settings > your profile and then click the home button. Swiping back goes to the last suggestion I opened no matter the page and closes reddit if there were no suggestions before it. Clearly need a little more effort on UX and testing.

The app has gone considerably downhill. Posts take up to a minute after clicking to load, when they load at all. You can no longer save videos or gifs, can't copy text, and the reliability to even load up at all is terrible. It seems to be down at least once a day for me... Some how has only gotten worse. Now when clicking a spoiler tagged line, the thread collapses and it cant be viewed.

Check your app after you update it. It's not working at all. It was stuck loading so I figured it needed an update. I was right, but it's still loading and not doing anything after the update. Edit: I just uninstalled and reinstalled it to see if it would make any changes. It did, but it's worse. I can't log in. It keeps saying "We are unable to authenticate you."

It has been acting horrible lately. Half the time you get the "we are having trouble getting reddit" or crashes while you are looking at stuff. If you are able to get it to work, it is still slow as heck, refresh is glitchy, and the filters aren't even worth it cause it still shows you the exact same posts.

Thr app STILL, after years and years, does not allow you to highlight and copy text. This means that you can not search anything you are reading without memorizing it and retyping. This appears to be a hamfisted attempt to keep people in-app by making it prohibitively hard to run a search on anything you read in app. This is nothing but over the top arrogance combined with a disdain of end users, which is apparently the current primary development mantra at Reddit.

Slow, buggy, and ugly. The UI and features are constantly being adjusted to the degree that it feels like everything is in beta. Damn near useless when compared to third party software. Just make the app easy to use and minimal bloat, how hard is that?

Buggy as hell. Received email that I had a chat request. Link to the chat request takes me to homepage. Chats on PC don't seem to transfer to mobile. Often freezes and has to be restarted. Tried to submit a bug report, but you have to report the exact version number. In order to find the version number, though, you have to erase your big report to go back and find it.

Have to fully restart the app around 5-6 times to get anything to work. Can't open threads, can't load comments, can't load new posts. If the app is open long enough it stops loading everything and you have to do the same song and dance over again. This has been happening for half a year at this point and seemingly gets worse every update.

Certain videos won't play. The play button displays but isn't clickable. The algorithm for determining the content on the front page is annoying in that it will heavily display the subreddit you recently visit at the expense of not showing content from other subreddit you subscribe to. In other words, personalized content is not well balanced. Privacy is also a concern because I often search something on a browser or unrelated app and see related content shown in the reddit app.

Mobile app is not nice to use. Too many glitches and problems. Rarely have a smooth experience using mobile app. All other times it's slow loading, incomplete loading, having to refresh pages over and over to get posts or comments to load. Audio from videos will continue to play well after scrolling away from original videos.

I swear Reddit has a worse design team than YouTube, and they've done some really dumb things, the new video layout is absolutely awful, if I'm looking at the comments I don't need to watch the video at the same time, it was perfect how it was and now it's terrible. Also I got a notification in my inbox to turn on "notifications" except it didn't specify that it was for EVERY SINGLE SUB that I follow, so I started getting tons of useless notifications with a very hidden way to disable it.

Crashes constantly, videos play maybe one in ten times, there are some ads that crash the app every time that you can't block. Incapable of saving where you are when you're browsing, so if you switch apps for ten seconds get ready to lose your place and only get recommended posts you've seen. Awful, awful app.

As of 3/14/23 the app is completely nonfunctional for me. It's not my internet connection or my phone; I tried off and on for hours to even open the app without success and when I uninstalled and reinstalled it, it refused to let me log in at all, just flashing the "we had some trouble getting to Reddit" error message. The app's functionality took a sharp dive last update and has not recovered at all; posts don't load the first five to fifty times you tap them, videos are completely broken, etc

The app sometimes loads 100% ads with no content. I won't watch any videos on reddit anymore because integration is terrible. I use the app because it handles uploading multiple photos to a post at once, which I can't do on the website. Just another restriction imposed to force you onto their app. It randomly fails to upload photos though, and won't ever say why. And by "sometimes" I mean like 75% of the time. The app is a turd. Endless scrolling gets an extra star even though it breaks daily.

This app was working great about 4 months ago, but then suddenly it changed. When tapping a thread to enter, it just doesn't respond for a very long time. Often times this will bring you to a different post or open the same post many times. Then, once youre in the post, you have to wait for a very long time to see replies. Often times when you are scrolling through your feed, the feed seems to be out of sync with the rendering of the UI

It's a good app, just annoyed that I can no longer read reddit posts on the web. It has to force me to the app or force people to make an account. Also, recently, for some reason, when I save an image, it will send it to a different folder and the image will be 0 bytes. It saves as a dead image. I move it to a different folder but it just won't recognize it as a file. I have to screenshot the images now which are not the original quality.

So many bugs. The amount of times I have to restart the app to stop a video playing in the background that I can't see or stop is ridiculous. And occasionally I can't put my screen in landscape mode, which occurs only in the reddit app. Seems like the people behind the scenes are amateurs who can't solve small problems that other media platforms have fixed years ago.

Videos and pics hosted by reddit can take long to load and some videos never play. The new way images are displayed in search results is terrible. Go back to displaying them fully in search results. When I click on a post now, it often takes 10 or more servings for it to actually open the post. If I made the mistake it clicking it multiple times, then I have to back out multiple times to get back to the homepage.

I don't know what they did to it, but this is actually one of the worst apps I have ever used. I have to restart the app multiple times to get it to load content, clicking on posts does nothing until they unexpectedly pop up 15 minutes later, comments don't load, media player is bad. The worst part was that it was fine about a year ago. Also the amount of stuff this app caches is crazy. It takes up insane amounts of storage space.

App recently changed from having to swipe to see multiple pictures on a post to now having to tap the right side of the screen to go through them. As a left handed person this is a terrible setting to change especially with seemingly no way to change it back. It seems like unnecessary changes are being made instead of focusing on fixing errors and glitches.

this app only gets worse as time goes on. you can't swipe right to view the next image in an image set, or swipe up to close out of an image, and swiping down is slow. scrolling through comments while watching a video will cause the comment box thing to go over the video, you're forced to use it if you want to view anything marked as 18+. the app also sonetimes has issues opening up links, and other times it just never loads.

Over time the experience has really deteriorated. It seems to me that the development team is only interested in achieving some sort of "slickness" while neglecting problems and constantly making the app worse. Most recently, they began hiding details of the poster, making difficult to discern if a post is genuine. The UI is often confusing and sometimes downright disfunctional (e.g. custom lists are a nightmare to deal with). Just a bad experience overall.

Far too many ads now. Every other 'post' is an ad and they're in all of the comments sections too. Sick and tired of everything becoming bloated with ads, it has ruined both YouTube and Reddit for me. Used to at least be able to block the ad accounts but now you can't, which means I keep seeing the same ads over and over again multiple times just by a rolling down the home page. It's pretty annoying, and makes me actually want to avoid buying the products. Will no longer be using this app.

It's been years now and the video player still isn't reliable. Buffering, never loading, outright failing with an error. That and many basic features keep breaking, or changing. Stuff moves around, small design elements change without a clear reason, then get reverted, then back again. It's very messy and quite a shameful display considering how much simpler it would've been to have a proper responsive website, instead of pushing people off the web and into this react-native mess.

Adding/fixing three features that would make this a 5-star app. 1. Improveing the video player. Sometimes videos are very slow to load even with a strong and fast internet connection. 2. Being able to send a direct message to a friend when sharing a post or comment. Copying and pasting the link is annoying. 3. Fixing the issue where revealing a spoiler comment collapses the comment thread.

I don't usually write reviews, but the official Reddit app is potentially one of the worst apps I've had to use, especially so coming from "the front page of the Internet." At its core, it works as intended, but when you actually do use it, there are many bugs that just gets fixed, but with new ones added in. I've never once used it without encountering a single bug. Currently, there is an issue starting chats on the app that happens randomly for days at a time.

At some point I liked this app, but it seems the user experience becomes slightly worse every update. The biggest recent change is the UI for looking at posts with images. This change isn't bad in itself. However, it makes it impossible to read long images, and swiping right cycles through the posts vertically? The implementation feels off.. There's also something like a memory leak, and after a while of using the app it slows down to a crawl and crashes. Use a third-party app instead.

Have been using it for several years now. I don't mind the interface changes, but there's several very noticeable bugs that the developers have just neglected completely. I know Reddit has a fairly limited budget, so it makes sense that their app isn't as polished, but these are bugs that have been around for a long time that severely affect the user experience, and yet the development team keeps focusing on adding new features or changing the UI instead of just fixing them.. not great.

Since the last update, the scrolling has become very slow. It doesn't run smoothly like every other app. The continuous scrolling seems to be gone. You can swipe the screen fast and it comes to a dead stop instead of slowly stopping. I really hate this. I'm not on an old phone either- s22 ultra, where every other part of this phone is buttery smooth.

This app is absolutely chock full of bugs and memory leaks. One problem that CONSISTENTLY drives me insane is when I click on a post, and the post that shows up is a different post from a different community. This happens all over the app. Beyond that, using the app for longer than 5 minutes can result in a crash more often than not, preceded by freezes, stuttering and sometimes flashing. It's a shame because the UI is awesome, but the app hasn't been stable for many months now.

The app works well, but for some reason the development team continues to make unnecessary and unneeded changes, such as moving the "Sort by" button to settings and switching the sides of the profile view panel from left to right. Nothing too terrible, but I find it VERY annoying and frustrating. Furthermore, it seems that with every update the devs are hellbent on making the ui even worse. If it ain't broke, don't fix it...

It worked completely fine a year ago. But recently they have been making it worse by the day. The UI is constantly changing, almost daily at this point, between different versions. Sometimes there are even different versions when I switch between profiles! And there are so many bugs, my main one si that sometimes the chat just doesn't allow you to send pictures at all. It worked completely fine a year ago, and I don't know why the ruined it

The bugs have been around FOR YEARS. It's getting ridiculous. Fix the app. It takes literally 5 to 10 minutes to be able to open a post. Often, the feed just doesn't load. Been like this for ages without anyone fixing it. And it's getting worse. Instead we get bs features like real-time interaction blah blah, nobody actually believes those numbers are real. If the main issue gets fixed, it's a great app.

Frustration, your entire app experience for a new user is ridiculous. Password and account verification prompts even tho its already been done, its annoying in the worst way. You wall people till its been completed but even after its done its still happening. More stress than its worth Edit: fast forward years later. App has been with the user since this post and has worked as expected. Great. Thank you for wonderful service!

What the hell is with the videos moving into the comments when you open it and being tiny and move around. So annoying at the top was fine. I try to close the tiny video bubble and end up hitting the video more than half the time which then takes me out of the comments and into the full screen video again. I would like the option to turn this off and put the video just back at the top

The recent features made it all the more worst. If you click on a video on the homepage then it opens the comment section and the video in pop-up mode floating, like why ? I am trying to watch video not to read comments from the get go. Also when trying to slide the progress bar of video it again switches back to comments. It have gotten hella more annoying then previously it had been.

Idk. But everything is almost as it's slow and lagging. The videos most of the times are on low quality even tough it's a high quality video. And sometimes it tooks time for Quality to suddenly change. Sometimes video, Gifs don't work instantly. While i'd rather watch 1080p youtube videos 1h long and without any pauses. Had nothing to do with the Internet. The concept of the app is great. But those bugs should be fixed. It makes the used frustrated and I end up everytime leaving the app after se

It's really bad. I have this issue where it will reload randomly when I switch to another window. I'm on android and I read this vould be related to allowing backgroun usage, so I turned that off. Thought it was fixed, but it's still happening. Checked that the setting was off. I'm tired of being on a post I like and then switching back to the app and it going back like 30 previous posts and its hard to find my way back. Fix your app.

Reddit recently removed the ability to open links in external apps. This is a major downgrade and inconvenience. Please restore this feature. Additionally the font type and size randomly changed today. This has made it more difficult to read everything. Clearing data had zero effect in troubleshooting a potential issue, so once again it's Reddit rolling out unannounced changes.

This might be the most broken garbage app I've ever had the displeasure of using. The app is just not functional, everytime I try to hide or stop a community from showing on my feed "sorry something went wrong". EVERY SINGLE TIME. Not once has any of the settings or options ever actually worked correctly, I just get that same error message over and over again. Don't even get me started on the video player which doesn't work half the time. The new god awful image UI, I guess swiping is too hard.

The only reason I was still using the main (buggy) app was because none of the unofficial ones allow to swipe between posts. Well they just removed that feature, along with the options to change view styles (e.g., compact, card, classic). Ads now take half the screen with the new default mode. Guess it's time to ditch this one and find one with the only 2 features I care about.

Often laggy. Video codex just doesn't work sometimes. Has options you can only access by going to the web-browser version, which is superior in most other ways as well. Has a clear preference toward showing religious-political ads, which is a violation of its own TOS. Done with this garbage.

App looks lovely and when it works itls great to use however there are a few issues. Loading times are incredibly long to the point I can have watched the youtube ads on my TV before a page loads. When I press on a thread it can take up to a minute to load, assuming it loads at all. These are now experiences I get when using it through my computer

Taking leaps back. Lately I've been unable to scroll from one post to the next. I have to exit the post, thus go back to my feed, and from there I can select the next post. Video's don't load more often than they do load so I can hardly ever watsh videos. And there's been an interface change that I really dislike. It all feels really old right now. Doesn't look nearly as nice and put-together anymore.

The UI is horrible with the new updates. The video player that was already bad somehow got worse. The images have the same Tiktok-like UI as the videos and the comments section always bug and don't show. There are many third party apps out there and the only thing stopping me from using them is the time it will take to get used to them.

I swear every update mobile users just get completely spunked, videos play after you've left the page and are viewing something else even with autoplay turned off, it just randomly decides to refresh when you're reading something, it takes an ungodly amount of time after you tap a post/comment button for it to actually load - sometimes not at all so you continue scrolling only for it to pop up a minute later. Bloody infuriating. But ads aren't intrusive and some quality content if you can find.

App sucks now. I used to be able to block users on sponsored posts (ads) so I didn't have to see the same ad over and over. I still got ads, but they would be different. Since Reddit broke I can block these accounts all I want, but the ads keep showing. If showing me an ad once doesn't make me want to buy a product or service, showing it to me a hundred times will make sure I never deal with that company ever again.

This app is terrible. Constant bugs that never get patched. When you tap a post, it will take you to the top of the front page instead of the post you want to view. If you want to tap a spoiler and see what it says, the comment thread collapses and doesn't show. These bugs are known about when you google them and have existed for awhile.

Why can't you hide the bar of the video player when you play the video on portrait?! To have a clean experience. Also there is a bug, were the navigation buttons for my android disappears and I can't go back or close the app until I navigate to the options menu. These are the only issues I'm having with reddit right now.

Reddit devs cannot get the video feature right. I do NOT want a floating pop-up video that I can't pause or mute! Having video controls while viewing comments was the best feature. Now I can't even vote on a post without backing out through all the video clicks. I hate this app more and more with every "update".

Great app for exploring and finding new details here and there, explore imagination and new sights. Although, i believe there are still some problems of which are necessary to be fixed, yet it is good to see it working well. Problems: Such as connection problems, logging into an account back and some videos and images not loading correctly. Those i believe should be fixed as soon as it can. Update: There is also some loading problems in following users, private messages too. Up: Even slower.

Discovered why the app is absolutely crashing after a while: it stacks whatever post and page you open inside the app on each other, up to 5 layers of non visible, but always active windows. That's why my text to speech would sometimes read the text of ads instead of the dialogue I have selected. That's why videos would play even when is nothing on screen. Reddit stacks every page you open until either the app closes them automatically, or the allocated memory is consumed, crashing the app.

They're overloading the home feed with so much "recommended" content that it's getting hard to see the posts you're actually signed up for. That, and it doesn't work in landscape mode, so it's useless on a tablet unless you stand the thing up on its narrow end. Disappointed.

I don't use it much, but it's great. The only complaint is that the option to leave a post (and not the app) closes the app as well and I have to relaunch the app to get to the home screen or go to the subreddit then the home menu. This only happens if I got to the post through a notification, but tedious nonetheless.

Reddit is great, but the app is extremely buggy and inconsistent. Each update breakes something else, the video player is an absolute joke everyone makes fun of. In the current version, you can't reveal text under spoiler tags because doing so (done by tapping the text) will also collapse the whole comment so you can't read it.

Was seriously enjoying the app, but now for some reason, my phone produces an ear-splitting screeching sound when scrolling, even when the device's volume is set to be muted. I have no idea why this is happening, but it is reproducible and happens when just scrolling through my feed, rendering the app entirely unusable.

This app is extremely buggy and frustrating to use. Whenever I try to watch a video, it only runs at 144p and takes a long time to load. Even worse, the video often keeps buffering and stops playing altogether. Additionally, the threads do not display properly, making it difficult to read the content

Stable app with few bugs but over time, with updates realeased every gew months or so, the experience has become less customisable and far more irritating. Personally I mostly used it to keep in touch with a few sub reddits, but even this is becoming more difficult, and then there's the hot mess that is 'All'. Most of Reddit is made up of endless reposts and twitter screenshots. If I wanted to view twitter, I'd join it. Would not recommend this app, I'm not sure I'd even recommend the site.

This is definitley the best way to access Reddit. Other Apps arrange information in a way that doesn't make sense to me. It's easy to view your SubReddits and browse new content. I'm really only dissatisfied with the "history" tracking. That's a bit too complex to go into detail here. Suffice to say, I am satisfied otherwise.

This app hasn't been the best as of late. Clicking on a subreddit takes me to a 5 minute loading screen. Clicking on a post on your feed just for another post to pop up. Posts taking a long time load. Honestly, it's just buggy in general and it's gotten worse. And, no, it isn't my internet nor my phone. This is the only app I have these issues with and my phone is up to date. Other reviews could back this up as well. Not sure what they plan to do about this.

EDIT: Six months now, and they still haven't fixed this. Seems deliberate. ***** PRIVACY ALERT ***** Latest version of this app removed a feature that allows you to specify which browser to use when opening links, forcing all links to open in Chrome. This essentially leaks every link you click on to Google. App is a massive privacy hole until they restore that feature.

For an app I use regularly, I can't use words to express how much I dislike it. Works fine on web but the time it takes for stuff to load in app is rubbish, especially when ads load instantly. Video player doesn't work properly, posts don't load properly, comments don't load properly. It's been over a year, the fact that it hasn't been fixed is even more worrying. Even trashier with the NFTs and the ads aren't even good.

Reddit itself is cool, but this app is absolute garbage. ‚Ä¢Video player barely works. When it does, it's only after loading for ages. ‚Ä¢Whenever you try to open a thread more often than not, it won't open. If it does open, it'll be after a 30sec delay. ‚Ä¢It doesn't refresh properly. ‚Ä¢Have to wait ages to be able to access your saved posts. ‚Ä¢Half of the time, when you upvote or save a post, it won't register. That's just a small sample of the problems. It's pretty much unusable.

This app has been brutal lately. Tons of bugs; videos won't play, spoiler comments immediately hide themselves after you reveal the spoiler, and the feed will often automatically open the first post in the feed regardless of which post you click. The latter has been happening for months if not years. You'd think an app as big as Reddit would eventually get fixed...?

Usually love this app and was a 5 star. The past 3 updates made it terrible and buggy. Having trouble starting a chat or messages and getting constant error as if it can't load due to connection even though my wifi n 5g work. The last 3 updates blow. I'll update if it gets fixes. Guess I'll try the desktop version....which I dislike since it has a lot and different from mobile

Perfecc! I love the April Fools events, so unique! Especially Place, that was beauty at its finest. I like that I could find people who share the same interests as me. Thank you for this now classic masterpiece of an app! Edit: I now have a complaint, for some reason if I want to comment an image and add a little too much words, it turns into an asterisk (*) and I can't put up with this anymore. And that's just one out of a lot of problems! Fix your app!

Reddit is a really nice app, but PLEASE fix the phone version. It's got so many bugs and I just can't take it. It absolutely pisses me. When I tap on a comment wanting to close it, it doesn't close. When I tap on a GIF comment wanting to close it, it opens the GIF. When there's a spoiler in the comments & I want to see it, I tap it & the comment closes. When I want to open a thread, it often takes 10+ seconds for it to open. Seriously, Reddit? There's many more bugs, please fix them.

It can be a good app, but often has loading speed issues. Changing between accounts can take really long. Big bug where trying to look at the comments of posts will just, not open, you can click to open comments and you will stay on the same page and without warning 1-2 minutes later, the comments will suddenly open, sometimes the comments are instant, but most of the time, it's like that.

Video player is super buggy. Refreshing the home page doesn't work consistently. Loading speeds are typically super slow. Home button doesn't work consistently. Sometimes you can only load the comment section of one post, no matter which post you click on.

When looking at comments in a video post, the video enters a tiny picture-in-picture rather than staying on top half. No way to change it in the settings. It has been switching back and forth for months. Better to use a third party app.

I used to Google whenever I needed help: something explained, an opinion found, a project assist, passions shared or even just stroll thru an endless variety of photo subjects. But Google has become one big advertisement, making it hard to know the real purpose of my $earch results. I could no longer trust what I was directed to. That was before I found Reddit & even though I still Google at times, Reddit's now my first go2 and a lot more fun. Like me now.

App completely broken with the addition of "This post is better if you share it!" Popup. Stays stuck on screen until I force close the app. Duplicates as I scroll, until eventually it's the only thing on my screen. Yet again they've implemented a feature to ruin the fun, yet again it breaks the app. Between this and the video player, I'm switching to a better version i.e. Reddit is fun or something.

App constantly crashes. Spoiler tags on posts collapse the post when you tap on them, giving a solid .1 seconds to read the spoiler text. My home feed refuses to load anything older than a day, and will gradually reduce the number of posts as I browse over the course of two-three minutes until it gets to "Nothing to see here" and a completely empty feed until I force close and re-launch. Genuinely worse than using reddit in browser on mobile. What an embarrassment for such a popular site.

The app improved the UI/UX and the video player a bit, but I still need video quality options. Every video I've opened has been in 144p. Also, I still wish swiping up on a video closes it rather than playing the next post. Also, zooming in on videos... please

Nice place, but need UI stability improvements (so it works without issues). Fix custom collections cause it's a gamble whether they will work out not when you visit them. Also they could be added to drop-down menu next "Home" and "Popular" feeds.

its not fully bad app but compared to website it is bad. most the the video which initially uploaded by redgif doesn't have voices in them only in website u can see most the the post take u to the chrome without asking permission to open the chrome and sometimes the video doesnt play it shows as if it is a photo and also in this type of situation the comments cant be read mainly please make voices available since most of the post were from redgif it can use properly in website but not in app.

Generous 1/5. They force you to use it instead of a mobile website. Can't copy text from comments. Stability has been good for a while. Videos load maybe 50% of the time and if it doesn't load, you can't see comments either. Topic loading can be pretty slow no matter the internet connection. Sometimes it keeps opening the same topic no matter what you try to open.

It's a pretty great app. They just need to fix their app. There have been huge problems with the video player for a long looong time and It's still not fixed. Instead of changing UI things no one asked for, instead fix things that are broken.

The biggest problem is that the videos and images take too long to buffer on Wifi, the same experience as using mobile data but the signal isn't strong. On the other side, I have no complaints or suggestions on this app

Was a 4 star now a 2 Their most recent ui update has ruined my experience. Posts have rounded corners, and imag sizes are compressed. What was once just scrolling is now scrolling and clicking on every post instead of just specific ones. The new update also made it to were certain posts crash the app immediately. I have reported said issues, and nothing has come of it.

You can definitely use this app for Reddit things and whatnot. However, I will strongly recommend that you use your PC/Laptop instead of this app. This app contains a very strong issue of being unable to load posts when you press them. It takes usually from 30 seconds to 5 minutes, if you are willing to wait that long. Same situation also applies to the comment section. This app could definitely be optimized and fixed better.

Demanding and condescending app. On the website, which otherwise works fine on mobile? "It's better on the app, we'll harass you until you use it!" Fine. I'll use the app. Can't have multiple tabs open, inconvenient, and you get more control over my -- in the app: "Don't take a screenshot, share a link!!" Don't tell me what to do. The sharable link is full of utm strings for tracking. I know that isn't required, because NPR gives me a trash-free link. You demanded I use the app. I hate it.

Stop updating the app and removing features, now I can't see the user who posted without going into the post, I can't scroll, now it just teleport instead of rolling so now it's super janky and annoying, and the "new" UI just took away the borders the posts and texts had. Maybe focus on making the player more consistent or actually adding useful features

Each update seems to get worse. Currently, new content will not load. It doesn't matter if I clear the app cache or force close, the app has been showing and loading the same content for days. This is on top of videos not wanting to play correctly or load and comments not wanting to show.

Every update this app it gets even more books which makes it a terrible experience. Trying to use this app is one of the most frustrating things I've done in a while, nothing will ever load and it seems like every single update they do makes the load times for post slower and slower.

They continue removing functionality from the app making it harder and harder to get the content I actually want to see. They took away the ability to filter your feeds so now you can only get whatever default they give you. On top of that they recently changed their videos to display in the same way as tiktoks do for no logical reason. The changes the app keeps trying to make to make reddit like other social media apps kinda suck and take away from what makes reddit unique.

(10/28/21) It has its issues, but nothing that would deter me from continuing to use it so far. The user base can actually be more of a problem than any of the bugs or other problems with the app, but that's just down to people being people. Edit: (4/14/23) I've downgraded my rating from 4 stars to 3 because the app does seem to be getting worse. At the very least, an issue exists where posts don't like to open if there's an update you haven't installed yet and I really do not like that.

Works about half the time. Can't upload to certain subs and other times it uploads and it gets not even a single view somehow, as if the post is hidden from everyone. The karma system is pretty ridiculous, tiring, and ends up doing the exact opposite of what it was intended for. Also the Messenger seems to never work.

Still terrible. Loading is still awful. Video clips still without sound. Tapping on spoiler marked text closes comments. Loading a thread or the home screen takes forever. Half the time I tap on a post, a different post loads up. You can get banned for nothing and never get an appeal heard by a real person. Reddit sucks.

Slowest app in existence. Sometimes it just straight up doesn't load. Tabs on the bottom are finicky and don't work half the time Edit: Well they didn't fix a single issue, but now the app yells at you for taking screenshots. Would give 0 stars if possible

You keep changing the app, but not for the better, posts now don't show the author without tapping through to the comments. The Home/Latest/Popular tabs are complete trash, my home page shows nothing anymore, the only way to see the posts of subreddits I sub to is to go to latest now. Lastly the new video player is horrible

This app has become unusable. The app takes ages to load and then freezes. When I open it the first time, it doesn't open at all and I have to close it and open it again. It's one of the worst apps I've ever used. I never leave review but im just hoping that posting this makes then fix it.

current revision of the video player is absolutely horrendous. works worse than the one previously (surprisingly), and consistently fails after about 15 minutes of app use. as of june 15, 2022, this has not been fixed. UPDATE 2: navigating in the tiktok-esque UI for videos is broken as well. i want to pause the video and it immediately rewinds it to the beginning of the video. i want to pause it, again, and it registers that as me clicking the home button and then it kicks me out of TikTok mode.

With the latest update the posts are shown in "frames" with round corners. Not only that looks ugly, the frame also blocks parts of the image or video, so I have to open the said post to view the picture or video fully. Please revert that and never ever bring it back

The app looked good already okay. They rounded all the corners of the posts (looks bad) and now you don't immediately see who posted the thing, but after you click on it. The platform is about the people who post things, let the pictures stay normal and show us who posted it.

Yall really messed up the app this time. Making the text smaller, I have to always tap "latest" to see my recent posts, going to subs and yall forcing yall own algorithm instead of the recent algorithm. This update leaves the Refresh button visible at the top ALL THE TIME now, only on the Popular feed, it used to disappear. This seriously impacts readability. Font size changed, is now smaller and more difficult to read. Please fix!

Nothing ever loads in the app. You have to spam a post 50 times for it to finally open. The video player pop-up feature is horrendous and blocks reading comments. Trying to take a screenshot of a post or comments causes an intrusive and creepy pop-up telling you to stop which blocks the screen, and there is no way to disable this privacy-invading pointless feature. Great app, I use it for years but please enhance the custom feeds. They are pretty well hidden now. And let us be able to remove communities from them in the app please. It's unbelievable how buggy this app is. I'll click one post and it'll take me to a completely different post. I'll collapse a comment and it'll open my browser to some random gif. Videos don't play sometimes. It's impossible to reveal spoilers or click links without collapsing the comment it's in.

Way too much ads (one every two or three posts). Video and gifs takes too much time to load, when it loads. Not possible to copy any link from a comment. Force opening websites into the embedded browser instead of the apps on your device. Cannot edit Multireddit.

No customization. No option for click to collapse comments. Every time I try to use this app (for it's rewards, live streams, chats) I get lost in all the clutter and suggestions on the frontpage. Ads that look identical to posts, constantly being told to "discover" or "explore". If I'm forced to use this app to reddit, I'll just quit reddit

When you open the app, it's completely blank. So I tried uninstalling and then reinstalling multiple times. Still is blank. Update: App still will not work, blank screen every time I open it. Will be deleting.

What the heck happened? Trending topics are gone, seems like the only way to see them is by tapping the search bar. Clicking on spoilers in the comments section also minimizes the comment im trying to unveil. Home and popular also no longer have the option to sort by any sort of particular filter, other than "hot". It almost seems deliberate at this point, but this app sucks.

I love Reddit, but the app is atrocious. Video player frequently fails to load videos, errors when trying to view profiles, or just slow in general, comments take forever to load, blocking accounts still makes you view their ads, etc. Use another app at this point.

It keeps getting slower it takes 5 mins just to load one post, and it's no exaggeration it actually takes 5 mins or more. I checked my network, and everything was fine. This app is practically unusable at this point.

This would be the best social media platform if it wasn't still stuck back in 2007. This app is so user UNFRIENDLY. So many bugs, posting options are limited and overly complicated. It's disappointing because it has so much potential.

Everyone is right. The app is worse I haven't even been able to use it for an entire year because it won't open it's just the reddit logo on the screen and nothing else. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling and restarting my phone the app just doesn't work.

You can always count on at least 2 or 3 videos in your feed to not properly load. After several years of using this app I'm also no longer expecting it to be fixed at some point. If you want an app that works 75% of the time - go ahead.

It won't load videos and gifs half the time. It's also very slow sometimes and comments often don't load either. Very very poorly made app. It's shocking that it manages to get worse and worse every update though. It's like they go and ask some middle school programmer to write it all for them and then they refuse to check the code so they just go, "yep looks good to me. Here's ten bucks little Bobby."

Way less functional than the mobile website and forced to use it seemingly at random. Web browsers have this feature called "tabs" where you can open multiple topics for later but the app has no such thing which makes it a downgrade. Only reason for a low rating is because the mobile website nags and sometimes forces use of the app; if the app was 100% optional I would have no problem with its limitations.

How is it possible for an app to regress in its quality? Just a couple of months ago, the app would run smoothly almost all the time. Sure, it didn't have as many useless "features", but now it takes so long to load everything. Even posts that are nothing but text and barely above 70 comments. This isn't just pathetic, it's sad. Sad how such a big company can produce something so mediocre at best.

They just keep making it worse. Adding things that they would call "features" but are just down right annoying. Why are the display cards rounded now? There was no reason to do that and now its just ugly looking to me. If i could just disable it then it would be fine. And comment chains collapsing with a single tap? Just extremely annoying, like why? I dont want to collapse it, i just want to unhide the text. I would honestly move to a better app if there was one.

I've only used the app, never the website. And I'm still pretty new to reddit and only using it for a few channels I follow, so haven't really explored all it had to offer. The app has been very easy to use, I've yet to run into a technical problem of any kind, and I get my updates. So it is working exactly as I would expect so far. They even let you personalize your user icon. Which is nice, some free some pay.

Broken app. So many error messages. Every, single time I get on Reddit, I get an error message. "We had trouble getting to reddit" (in app). "Something went wrong." I can't get to comments, the page often goes blank, and I am reminded why I've backed off using it so much. It's just broken and bad. Fix your app!

Playing videos in the background of popups so you have to close out of the post to mute the post playing behind it on the home page. Showing OTHER PEOPLE'S posts on someone else's profile. NFTs. Overall performance of the app makes me expect my phone to catch fire because of how long it takes to process, I have literally had this app lag so hard that it stalls my system processing and gives me an option to force close not the app, but my own system processing. Fix this tangle of spaghetti code

At one point I used to be able to post in the group I am in. Now I can't because for Android users they took the flair option away. Contact support and they sent me a link to here. For the last two weeks, the app has experienced considerable slowdown. It takes forever to load a page and whenever I want to see a community it says "cannot view community." Since the last update yesterday, reddit doesn't work at all. Only a blank screen shows up. I tried reinstalling the app, but now it won't let me sign and and says "something has gone wrong" when I want to reset the password. The browser version is no better. What gives?

The only problem, is the greed, too many intrusive ad's.. I love to read and learn, but the ads just jump in and blocks your view, and that sucks, they could do better, if not me and everyone else that has this problem will leave, that will stop the ads and the site.

Doesn't work without Wi-Fi or 5G, and even on Wi-Fi, it will bypass explicit directions not to use mobile data. It uses mobile data when it should be porting through a wi-fi router; it also accesses the internet when it's closed, to the detriment of anyone with a limited data plan. The most expensive app I've ever used.

It's an app for all sorts of people. You make your account, explore and enjoy, that's it! It's so convenient to use. The platform is vast, it covers all kinds and all types of interests of people. And it's people who control it. According to me it's the best social media app out there.

New update is absolute garbage. You used to be able to sort posts on the home page, for example:have the option to see top posts in your feed within a specific timeframe (24 hrs/1 week/1month etc), but now they got rid of that option. They now have complete control over what posts you see on the home page and it's all just random and disorderly posts. So if you want to see specific posts by the way you have them sorted you will have to go to each individual subreddit I never use this app anymore

App has been slow/unresponsive for ages and has never been improved. It can take forever for posts to open after tapping them with comments not loading at all. In additon, If you're playing a video in your feed, if you do go into a post with that video still playing on your screen you'll still hear its audio as if you were still watching it. I would've expected better for a site that always prompts you to use it instead of via a browser.

With every update it's worsening, the only thing that's updated is that there are more places for adds and now adds auto play . I initially gave it 5 stars it was much better a few years ago, but like any organization that let's marketing have too much power it ends up pushing more and more adds to the point where where the original function of the app is lost.

Force me to use the app to watch some videos but then many videos won't load in the app and have to copy link to browser to watch. What a joke. A quick Google search shows this has been an on and off problem for over 5 years. Really 5 years and you can figure this out.

Whatever new update there was absolutely sucks. I get the purpose behind hiding username on posts to clean up. Before, I would have to click someone's username to see a video since the video player sucks so much, but now there's no way to do that. So now, we have a bad video player and no way to watch around that. Good job!

When I used the app 11 months ago, I had premium and the only real plus outside of awarding others was it allowed me to dress up in more culturally representative clothing. It was really cool to tell new people about the free award every 24hrs and give them a neat one for their karma. Now I'm back, the clothes I thought I paid for are gone. The free awards are gone. This app should be called ads with reddit. You have too many ads. Worse than YouTube. Edit: Last update actually made the app worse. The longer you scroll the faster it slows and crashes. When it works it's great! Unfortunately there are tons of load issues and errors that refuse to load content. Making you wait hours before it decides to work. The app needs updated. If you could just browse on mobile without the app, this would be less of an issue but they push you to use the app.

I've used Reddit for many years now, both as a user and a moderator of larger Subreddits like r/Splatoon and r/PokemonUnite. The mobile app has come a looooooooong way. Historically, the mobile app has been very user centric with clumsy controls and limited moderation actions. That has changed. From alerts to the UI look to mod queue control, more and more desktop functionality has come to Reddit mobile, and I love it. I am a Reddit premium subscriber, so I do not get ads in the app.
Loads fast and is reliable. Great layout and easy to navigate. I would like to see the ability to sort my home feed into categories like when visiting a subreddit, "Hot" "New" "Top" etc.

This app is sometimes somewhat functional, but has many, many annoying bugs that make it a pain to use. Tapping on the link to expand more comments just disappears. Tapping on a spoiler tag to reveal what's beneath collapses the comment. The video player has many if it's own problems, like extremely tiny targets for muting and seeking. With all their income from awards and subscriptions, are they still unable to afford to build a functional app?

(Update: chat is still broken half the time and I still have to copy paste to my browser to start a new conversation.) Chat is broken since y'all updated. I have to copy/paste profile links to my browser, set my browser to desktop mode every time and then type in an itty bitty chat window and hope I don't fxxk it up. The app isn't the most comfortable to use but at least chat has never given me any shxt until the last update.

After a long time, the lag was fixed. Or I'm not sure if it has to do with me logging in with a different account. Wait. This was before I realized swiping right opens comment while the video is playing minimized. And I cannot read longer image description. Taking off 4 stars.

I have actually been using Reddit for years and also it's constantly been among my preferred applications. With over 100,000 neighborhoods concerning every subject you could think about (as well as a few you 'd most likely never think of if it wasn't for the imagination of complete strangers on the net), Reddit is the area where you can dive into anything as well as connect with individuals on any topic. The app is incredibly user-friendly and also there is constantly something new to discover.

If youve used desktop reddit its essentially the same thing. With some nice mobile features added. The only thing is, feels like half the time I spend on this app a lot of stuff breaks. Video player not working, posts not loading having to save the post and reset the app to properly view. When I try to read a spoiler it just collapses the thread(i cant read spoilers). I tap one post, it gives me a previous post. This app frustrates me a lot.

Really love this thing. So many people just expressing their opinions on all the topics in the world, it's fascinating how many different angles are there to our perception. Technically speaking I've not noticed any bugs in the app either.

Regularly crashes, the search function is useless. The website regularly forces my phone to use the app, then the app often fails. The videos often won't play. Or sometimes their audio will play when you've clicked on something else. Often you cannot click on spoilers/hidden text without the text disappearing completely. It's incredible how such a good idea for a website can have such a terrible app.

Garbage, the only reason I have this is for access to the IM. RedditIsFun is way better. Videos play automatically, videos loop automatically, you can't zoom on video, UI is a mess, everything is bunched up on top of itself, auto refresh is a terrible idea. Worst video player I've ever seen

As of the day I write this, the app doesn't work. All I get is a black screen that doesn't load, and if I try to view a Subreddit, it says I can't view the community. My account was PERMANENTLY Suspended for a BS reason, and Reddit refuses to restore it. What is the point of having this app, if I can't use it the way it's meant to be used? Other problems are various bugs, tapping on a post, having it load multiple times, comments not loading, videos not playing, etc. 1 GB = Not Worth It.

I have noticed that the quality of this app has gone down. I want to change one word in my bio but it keeps saying that " changes failed to save" or my profile won't even upload saying something similar. please fix, it took a year for the logging in issue to stop.

I am simply writing a review because I've been asked everyday for one and I've been avoiding it because I don't have anything good to say. App massively drains battery. I'm not going back. Stop trying to force me to install your app via a browser pop-up. Every update they just make the worst changes imaginable to the UI, making it take much longer to get to simple things. This app is a scam! Don't pay for premium, got my account locked for no reason and can't access reddit premium that i paid for and since it conveniently just hit over 60 days I can't get a refund. Mind you I had been a loyal premium user for almost 2-3 years and never done anything wrong.

Lasttist update got rid of user names at the top of each post on the home page. This is super annoying as i have to click the post just to then click on the user name to see theyre feed, this is super annoying. Even if i just want to see who posted it is super importaint. This "simpler" design is just terriable and makes me waste excessive time that i didnt before. Its quite annoying and makes me want to use the app less and use others like IG or tiktok more.

One of these days I would love to be able to give this app another positive review. They've fixed a LOT of issues which is why it's getting more than one star, but they still have a long way to go. They recently updated to look and just took off corners and now won't let you see a poster's name without clicking on the post. One day, Reddit... One day...

The best part of using Reddit is getting the notifications of what people have posted to it along with people's comments to those posts. However, creating a post on it seems too restrictive. I would like to have an interface where you can place any combination of things in the same post instead of it being so restrictive.

I tried out the official app after the announcement that third party app will become subscription based. It's horrible. Ads everywhere, cluttered UI, terrible ad filled comment section. Save yourself the time, either drop reddit or pay for a subscription on another app. I've used reddit for more than a decade, but with this I'm dropping it completely. I'm sad about it. **ALSO CHECK HOW MUCH PERSONAL DATA THEY ACCESS AND MINE VS RIF OR APOLLO. JUST FOR THIS REASON I'M UNINSTALLING DIRECTLY**

App doesn't even load at all sometimes. The new layout is missing features from the old layout. You must now scroll through the entire list of joined subreddit instead of jumping with the alphabet shortcuts. Video player is forced without able to view comments. Collapsing comments vibrates phone. UI blocks your screen when viewing an image. Now it lags too much.

Forced to use app rather than web to view content. Takes minutes to respond to taps on screen to navigate home feed. Impossible to hide gif comments, instead it opens an external web link. Adverts disguised as posts to trick you into reading

I'm not really sure why everyone says the app is bad. Not only is it fully functional, you can also search with a high degree of freedom based on date, popularity, media type, etc, something even the most popular of social medias don't even think to do (in fact, their search functions are usually abysmal).

Please add an app lock feature with fingerprint, password etc. So that I don't have to sign out when someone else can sign in with my Google saved password. Plus there's also nsfw not everyone who's having my phone needs to see. Thanks

App is fine. Reddit TV or whatever it's called however is utterly horrendous. Can't play videos half the time, then keeps playing vids (mostly ads but content too) even once you scroll past. Can't pause without opening the video, which keeps playing after you close it again. Absolute nightmare.

2023.10.0 - update has broken so many features. Blocking accounts now only works sometimes, split screening the app no longer works at all. Wishing that I'd stopped updating the app a year ago... Hiding posts no longer works on the Popular page - once you refresh the Popular page all of the hidden posts reappear. The Popular page is only usable once a day since I don't want to scroll through dozens of posts I've seen before. People have complained about this for months but it hasn't been fixed.
The past few months my wife and I have been having massive delays when clicking anything. Pictures or videos take forever to load or don't ever. The app was never great. But it's darn right unusable.

Android app is buggy as hell. If you click on a post some other random post will open or nothing will happen. They have so many open bugs for this and apparently only the reditt devs/admins cannot reproduce the issue for more than a year now. If you are too patient or have no issue with going to Android app settings and clear cache and data every few hours, go for this app by all means.

Works great on my Galaxy S8 and now my Galaxy S10. Fun social app that allows you to connect with others in topics and discussions you're interested in, view pics of things you may not see everyday, but the best part is that if you do NOT like a post or discussion, you can easily and freely scroll on to the next thing and even let the app know that you don't want to see posts like the one you didn't like.
I love the app withe the exception of the times it will not open when I chose to open from a link. I know it has issues with the cache. I just deal with it. Otherwise, it's great!

Slow to open posts, doesn't always load comment section, tapping on videos sometimes takes you to different video, tapping on posts sometimes opens a different post, trying to collapse a comment sometimes opens a GIF, subs are slow to load, sometimes feed gets cut off when browsing a sub or main feed, slow to clear search history, post history, and visited subs history. This app is busted.

Can't live without it now! There have been so many tech related issues for me over the last year of using this app that all I have to do is jump on the subreddit of the related product and either ask the community for help or someone already has and the solution is posted on the page. My favourite form of social media too as I dictate what comes up on my news feed as they are the subreddits I joined. Just brilliant.

Slow and full of glitches. I swear, this app gets worse and worse which each update. Posts take forever to load and videos flat out refuse to play most of the time. I'm seriously considering going back to an older version of this app. I mean, at least then the videos would actually play.

Custom Feed takes far too long to load, interface is constantly changing. Big updates mean that you can no longer find things where they once were. Lately my feeds only show the community link on posts, where as before it would also have a link to the user of the original post on that particular community. Meaning I need to waste time and manually search for the user. User experience seems to be getting worse with every new update.

Genuinely one of the worst social media apps, I'm just gonna list some of the disgustingly user unfriendly features you'll find. -Crashing -Several minute long loadtimes for a single post -Slowdown after using the app for more than a few minutes -Hideous looking grey popup literally begging you to use the inbuilt "save image" or the share button when you go to screenshot. They have nothing to gain from preventing screenshots and this ruins long screenshots of funny comment chains, pathetic.

Reddit is great, but the official app is easily the most broken, uncooperative, and frustrating way to browse it. This app is non functional more often than not. Update 4/20/23: Not only is it still terrible, but Reddit has begun charging for API access, making it harder for alternative apps to stay afloat. Awful app by a miserably run site.

The app is just okay. Not as streamlined and clean as the "reddit is fun (rif)" app, and not as accessible or convenient or fast as the website itself in "old" mode. I resent that the site constantly harasses mobile users to switch to the app, and then makes the app such a mediocre experience. Even better, once you've relented to the mobile site's constant harassment to get the app, the app itself constantly harasses you to write a review! So here's your review, guys! 1 star.

Reddit keeps giving me notifications to rate the app. So one star, due to the lack of free awards now. Plus all my adds are weird gambling apps, stuff about Jesus christ being a refugee, and erectile dysfunction ads. Like what??? I get that reddit has a predominantly male audience but it's just very uncomfortable to see when the ads are every 3 posts.

I wish they would quit messing with these updates that keeps making their app unusable. Nothing shows on my homepage and they removed the latest tab. Guess I have to switch to a more reliable third-party app.

if I could rate 0 stars I would. Ads are not just unavoidable but you can not opt out of specific advertisers. Even nontargeted ads are targeted. block feature broken. "do not recommend content" settings do not work. the right to say "no" has truly been taken away in the digital age. find a better website. total sellouts, do not respond to feedback, make feedback as difficult as possible and as impersonal as possible. This company hates you.

The latest update has basically crippled the app. When scrolling through videos, if I go back to the previous video it crashes, I cannot open comments, I can't post sometimes. This app has really, really took a turn off the deep end. GOOD LUCK using it.

It has a very wide range of options for you to watch, if you like woodwork then you can watch and talk to others for advice, if you love art and graphic novels like me you can find just about anything. There are some R rated things as well but you can avoid it if you're not looking for the scary stuff lol

Worst app for browsing Reddit. How have they still not fixed the issue of some videos not playing? You used to be able to tap on the video source next to the title of the post to open it in browser to watch the video, but they've now removed that. I'll be using a new app now.

KakaoTalk is an excellent carrier application that is loved by countless individuals around the world. It deals with mobile, desktop computer as well as even wearable gadgets, so you can always remain connected. The application has lots of attributes, consisting of voice as well as video clip messaging, team messaging and even more. It's very easy to utilize and also ideal for remaining in touch with family and friends.

Easy to use, free chat and video calling and more. Responsive customer service when needed. Only glitch is it's non-English speaking company (Korean) so there are a few bumps here and there. Also transferring your service to a new phone is complicated, especially if you get a new number, too (you lose photos, videos--even more if not very careful). On the other hand, it offers nice emoji and can be downloaded and used by everyone including people who have nothing to do with Korea.

I used to absolutely love this app for messaging, my boyfriend and I use it all the time, but with the past few updates, it hardly ever sends notifications any more, and I have to check the app constantly to be sure I am not missing any messages coming through. Not only that, but I now my S Gear Sport no longer vibrates when I actually do receive, I have checked everything I can possibly think of to see why it might not vibrate with Kakao. I checked to make sure that the notifications settings in the app were set, and they are, even check the S Gear app to make sure they were on, and are. I even uninstalled and reinstalled both apps. Short of resetting my phone, I am lost. If all this can be fixed, I would give more stars. Oh, and I have a Samsung Galaxy S9.

I noticed I didn't receive any messages at peak time for me... until I opened the app. I got a glaringly yellow screen that read "Updating". I was concerned about how much data this was using up as my battery was running low. After it updated, I received all the messages, all at once. Because of this experience, I missed a very important message and replied 4 hours late. This is badly designed. Please fix this immediately... had this been an emergency, there would've been tragic consequences.

This was my app that I lived by to keep with my friends in Korea. Lately this thing is a mess. I don't hear the ring tones, the video constantly freezes, and I keep getting " this feature is unavailable right now." Before any say it's due to internet connection, I have tried to use my phone data and turned of Wi-Fi so there is no excuse!!! This problem needs to be addressed immediately because this has been going on for a month and a half.

In general, the app is good. Especially I like the feature to be able to send the links to my own account for future reading/watching. However, the voice call doesn't ring at all. I miss "all" calls because of this. I tested it several times but even when the app is open and I'm staring at it, it's a hit or miss. Something is wrong. Hope it's fixed soon. Therefore only two stars.

I would've given this a five until their recent update. I never get notifications from my friends when they send me messages, and yes I checked the settings. Still did nothing. I tried emailing them, didnt work. If you're going to put an email up, at least set it up. This app has been slowly getting worse and worse. Might be time to uninstall it unless they fix everything.

You already know the pros. Here are the cons: unable to backup and restore (medias) to a new/another smartphone. Unable to install on SD card. Automatically adding friends without consent. Older android devices are not supported. Outdated UI and interface. This app is from the past, still stuck in the past, and will slowly disappear with the past.

Earlier this year the app did not work for international users. However, the issue has been corrected. The developer listens. Great app for communication with friends. Whether in South Korea, or elsewhere. Note: It takes a few minutes for the verification txt/calls to come through. The 2 min timer multiplies times three for me. There are very minor latency issues in the network surrounding this minor issue. I suspect due to international connections to send the verification txt/call. ‚ô•

This app could really use some better storage options. It should at least be able to be moved to the SD card. I use the app for work and it's now taking up 5+ GB. Space is really becoming an issue. It wouldn't be so bad if the app could be moved to the SD card. Also, the way you add contacts is way too complex. You have to scan a barcode? Half the time I really need to think about how to find the barcode. Why can't you just search for a contact and add them like normal?

Pros: Helpful with international communication. Cons: Not a user friendly app. It takes multiple tries to find anything within menus or do something as simple as adding friends. Barely existing support that is unhelpful 9 times out of 10. Won't let you change your ID after making it. Allows blocked people to still view your photos/updates to profile. appName: Tango - Live Video Broadcasts and Streaming Chats
review_description: Really liking this app so far, came over from Buzzcast since they ruined it over there. The previews are great but a little inconsistent. Video quality is consistently high. My only complaint is sometimes you pay to join a premium stream and it end quickly, then you would have to pay again to join when it restarts.

Hyperlink format will hijack the whole post. Takes all day to load every page because of all the bells and whistles, and if you try to use them you might crash.
